'''Jatland''' is the area with majority of the [[Jat]] Community<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/will-convert-delhi-into-jat-land-on-march-20-yashpal-malik-on-jat-stir-117030301056_1.html|title=Will convert Delhi into 'Jat land' on March 20: Yashpal Malik on Jat stir|last=India|first=Press Trust of|date=2017-03-03|work=Business Standard India|access-date=2018-08-31}}</ref> in [[Northern India]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.news18.com/news/movies/is-haryana-is-the-new-switzerland-for-bollywood-filmmakers-romanticize-jatland-like-never-before-996635.html|title=Is Haryana the new Switzerland for Bollywood?- Filmmakers romanticise Jat land like never before|work=News18|access-date=2018-08-31}}</ref> that covers some part of [[Delhi]], [[Haryana]],<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.jagran.com/haryana/panchkula-bjp-allure-farmers-in-jatland-of-haryana-18274328.html|title=हरियाणा के जाटलैंड में किसानों को लुभाएगी भाजपा, ताकत दिखाने की तैयारी|work=Dainik Jagran|access-date=2018-08-31|language=hi}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://naidunia.jagran.com/national-all-eyes-on-modi-rally-in-jatland-202144|title=जाटलैंड में मोदी की रैली पर नजर|work=Nai Dunia|access-date=2018-08-31}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://m.navbharattimes.indiatimes.com/state/punjab-and-haryana/chandigarh/prime-minister-narendra-modi-rohtak-rally-for-praises-deenbandhu-sir-chhotu-ram-from-jatland-haryana/articleshow/66135166.cms|title=PM Modi Rally in Haryana: PM Narendra Modi Rohtak Rally for praises Deenbandhu Sir Chhotu Ram from Haryana's Sampla - मोदी रैली इन सांपला: पीएम नरेंद्र मोदी ने बताया सरदार पटेल-सर छोटूराम कनेक्शन, रहबर-ए-आजम के बहाने 'जाटलैंड' पर नजर|work=Navbharat Times|access-date=2018-10-10|language=hi-IN}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://hindi.firstpost.com/amp/politics/narendra-modi-in-jatland-prime-minister-narendra-modi-unveils-statue-of-peasant-leader-sir-chhotu-ram-153150.html|title=जाटलैंड में मोदी: जाटों और किसानों को जोड़े रखने की कोशिश|website=hindi.firstpost.com|language=en|access-date=2018-10-10}}</ref> [[Punjab]], [[Uttar Pradesh]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/cities/lucknow/in-up-jatland-bjp-relies-on-charan-singh-tikait-names-to-draw-crowds-for-modi-rally/lite/|title=In UP Jatland, BJP relies on Charan Singh, Tikait names to draw crowds for Modi rally|date=2014-01-29|work=The Indian Express|access-date=2018-10-10|language=en-US}}</ref> and [[Rajasthan]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.patrika.com/jind-news/hooda-s-shout-in-favor-of-farmers-from-jatland-1128683/|title=जाटलैंड से किसानों के हक में हुड्डा की हुंकार|work=www.patrika.com|access-date=2018-08-31|language=hi-IN}}</ref> It mainly cover the Delhi-Chandigarh belt.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/punjab/khalistan-seeker-simranjit-mann-s-sad-a-now-demands-jat-land-state/story-xKmAzdyGEDqZYxMTDwITAI.html|title=Khalistan-seeker Simranjit Mann's SAD (A) now demands 'Jat-land' state|date=2016-03-23|work=Hindustan Times|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://m.jagran.com/lite/haryana/panchkula-bjp-is-plannig-a-rally-of-pm-modi-in-jatland-14334000.html|title=Jatland|last=|first=|date=|work=Jagran|access-date=}}</ref>

{{Redirect|Dry land|other uses|Land (disambiguation)}}
[[File:AYool topography 15min.png|thumb|Map showing [[Earth]]'s land areas, in shades of green and yellow.]] [[File:Knight's Point, West Coast.jpg|thumb|Rugged coastline of [[Knight's Point]], [[New Zealand]]]]
'''Land''', sometimes referred to as '''dry land''', is the solid surface of [[Earth]] that is not permanently covered by [[water]].<ref>Michael Allaby, Chris Park, ''A Dictionary of Environment and Conservation'' (2013), p. 239, {{ISBN|0199641668}}.</ref> The vast majority of human activity throughout history has occurred in land areas that support [[agriculture]], [[habitat]], and various [[natural resource]]s. Some life forms (including [[terrestrial plant]]s and [[terrestrial animal]]s) have developed from predecessor species that lived in [[body of water|bodies of water]].
Areas where land meets large bodies of water are called [[coast|coastal zones]]. The division between land and water is a fundamental concept to humans. The demarcation between land and water can vary by local jurisdiction and other factors. A [[maritime boundary]] is one example of a political demarcation. A variety of natural boundaries exist to help clearly define where water meets land. Solid rock [[landform]]s are easier to demarcate than marshy or swampy boundaries, where there is no clear point at which the land ends and a body of water has begun. Demarcation can further vary due to tides and weather.
== Etymology and terminology == {{original research section|date=March 2018}} {{refimprovesect|date=March 2018}}
The word 'land' is derived from Middle English ''land'', ''lond'' and [[Old English]] ''land'', ''lond'' (“earth, land, soil, ground; defined piece of land, territory, realm, province, district; landed property; country (not town); ridge in a ploughed field”), from Proto-Germanic ''*landą'' (“land”), and from Proto-Indo-European ''*lendʰ-'' (“land, heath”). Cognate with Scots ''land'' (“land”), West Frisian ''lân'' (“land”), Dutch ''land'' (“land”), German ''Land'' (“land, country, state”), Swedish ''land'' (“land, country, shore, territory”), Icelandic ''land'' (“land”). Non-Germanic cognates include Old Irish ''lann'' (“heath”), Welsh ''llan'' (“enclosure”), Breton ''lann'' (“heath”), Old Church Slavonic ''lędо'' from Proto-Slavic ''*lenda'' (“heath, wasteland”) and Albanian ''lëndinë'' (“heath, grassland”) from ''lëndë'' (“matter, substance”).
A continuous area of land surrounded by ocean is called a "landmass". Although it may be most often written as one word to distinguish it from the usage "[[Land#Land mass|land mass]]"—the measure of land area—it is also used as two words. Landmasses include [[supercontinent]]s, [[continent]]s, and [[island]]s. There are four major continuous landmasses on [[Earth]]: [[Afro-Eurasia]], the [[Americas]], [[Antarctica]] and [[Australia (continent)|Australia]]. Land, capable of being [[plough]]ed and used to grow [[crop]]s, is called [[arable land]].<ref>''[[Oxford English Dictionary]]'', {{nowrap|3rd ed.}} "arable, ''adj.'' and ''n.''" Oxford University Press (Oxford), 2013.</ref> A country or region may be referred to as the [[Homeland#Motherland|motherland]], [[fatherland]], or [[homeland]] of its people. Many countries and other places have names incorporating [[-land]] (e.g. [[New Zealand]]).
== History of land on Earth == {{Main article|History of Earth}}
[[File:Earth formation.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Artist's conception of [[Hadean|Hadean Eon]] Earth.]] [[File:Pangea animation 03.gif|thumb|300px|An animation showing the movement of the continents from the separation of [[Pangaea]] until the present day.]]
The earliest material found in the Solar System is dated to {{val|4.5672|0.0006|ul=bya}} (billion years ago);<ref name=bowring_housch1995>{{cite journal|last1=Bowring|first1=S.|last2=Housh|first2=T.|title=The Earth's early evolution|year=1995|doi=10.1126/science.7667634|journal=Science|volume=269|pmid=7667634|issue=5230|bibcode = 1995Sci...269.1535B|pages=1535–1540 }}</ref> therefore, the Earth itself must have been formed by [[accretion (astrophysics)|accretion]] around this time. By {{val|4.54|0.04|u=bya}},<ref name="age_earth1">See: * {{cite book|first1=G.B.|last1=Dalrymple|year=1991|title=The Age of the Earth|publisher=Stanford University Press|location=California|isbn=978-0804715690}} * {{cite web|last=Newman|first=William L.|date=2007-07-09|url=http://pubs.usgs.gov/gip/geotime/age.html|title=Age of the Earth|publisher=Publications Services, USGS|accessdate=2007-09-20|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20051223072700/http://pubs.usgs.gov/gip/geotime/age.html|archivedate=2005-12-23|df=}} * {{cite journal|last1=Dalrymple|first1=G. Brent|title=The age of the Earth in the twentieth century: a problem (mostly) solved|journal=Geological Society, London, Special Publications|year=2001|volume=190|issue=1|pages=205–221|url=http://sp.lyellcollection.org/cgi/content/abstract/190/1/205|accessdate=2007-09-20|doi=10.1144/GSL.SP.2001.190.01.14|bibcode=2001GSLSP.190..205D|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071111141237/http://sp.lyellcollection.org/cgi/content/abstract/190/1/205|archivedate=2007-11-11|df=}} * {{cite web|last1=Stassen|first1=Chris|date=2005-09-10|url=http://www.talkorigins.org/faqs/faq-age-of-earth.html|title=The Age of the Earth|publisher=[[TalkOrigins Archive]]|accessdate=2008-12-30|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/617EZCiyN?url=http://www.talkorigins.org/faqs/faq-age-of-earth.html|archivedate=2011-08-22|df=}} </ref> the primordial Earth had formed. The [[formation and evolution of the Solar System]] bodies occurred in tandem with the Sun. In theory, a [[Formation and evolution of the Solar System#Formation of the planets|solar nebula]] partitions a volume out of a [[molecular cloud]] by gravitational collapse, which begins to spin and flatten into a [[circumstellar disc]], which the planets then grow out of in tandem with the star. A nebula contains gas, ice grains and [[cosmic dust|dust]] (including [[primordial nuclide]]s). In [[nebular hypothesis|nebular theory]], [[planetesimal]]s commence forming as [[Granular material#Granular gases|particulate]] matter accrues by [[cohesion (geology)|cohesive clumping]] and then by gravity. The assembly of the primordial Earth proceeded for 10–{{val|20|ul=myr}}.<ref name=nature418_6901_949>{{cite journal|last1=Yin|first1=Qingzhu|title=A short timescale for terrestrial planet formation from Hf-W chronometry of meteorites|journal=Nature|year=2002|volume=418|issue=6901|pages=949–952|doi=10.1038/nature00995|pmid=12198540|last2=Jacobsen|first2=S. B.|last3=Yamashita|first3=K.|last4=Blichert-Toft|first4=J.|last5=Télouk|first5=P.|last6=Albarède|first6=F.|bibcode = 2002Natur.418..949Y }}</ref>
Earth's atmosphere and oceans were formed by [[Volcano|volcanic]] activity and [[outgassing]] that included [[water vapor]]. The [[origin of the world's oceans]] was condensation augmented by water and ice delivered by [[asteroid]]s, [[Protoplanet|proto-planets]], and [[comet]]s.<ref name="watersource">{{cite journal|display-authors=1|last1=Morbidelli|first1=A.|last2=Chambers|first2=J.|last3=Lunine|first3=J.I.|last4=Petit|first4=J.M.|last5=Robert|first5=F.|last6=Valsecchi|first6=G.B.|last7=Cyr|first7=K.E.|title=Source regions and time scales for the delivery of water to Earth|journal=Meteoritics & Planetary Science|year=2000|volume=35|issue=6|pages=1309–1320|bibcode=2000M&PS...35.1309M|doi=10.1111/j.1945-5100.2000.tb01518.x}}</ref> In [[faint young Sun paradox|this model]], atmospheric "[[greenhouse gas]]es" kept the oceans from freezing while the newly forming Sun was only at 70% [[solar luminosity|luminosity]].<ref name="asp2002">{{cite conference|last1=Guinan|first1=E.F.|last2=Ribas|first2=I.|title=Our Changing Sun: The Role of Solar Nuclear Evolution and Magnetic Activity on Earth's Atmosphere and Climate|location=San Francisco|publisher=Astronomical Society of the Pacific|bibcode=2002ASPC..269...85G|isbn=1583811095|editor=Benjamin Montesinos, Alvaro Gimenez and Edward F. Guinan|booktitle=ASP Conference Proceedings: The Evolving Sun and its Influence on Planetary Environments}}<!--|accessdate=2009-07-27--></ref> By {{val|3.5|u=bya}}, the [[Earth's magnetic field]] was established, which helped prevent the atmosphere from being stripped away by the [[solar wind]].<ref name=physorg20100304>{{cite news|author=Staff|title=Oldest measurement of Earth's magnetic field reveals battle between Sun and Earth for our atmosphere|date=March 4, 2010|work=Physorg.news|url=http://www.physorg.com/news186922627.html|accessdate=2010-03-27|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110427064855/http://www.physorg.com/news186922627.html|archivedate=April 27, 2011|df=}}</ref> The atmosphere and oceans of the Earth continuously shape the land by eroding and transporting solids on the surface.<ref>NOAA. [http://oceanservice.noaa.gov/education/literacy/ocean_literacy.pdf Ocean Literacy] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141127095900/http://oceanservice.noaa.gov/education/literacy/ocean_literacy.pdf |date=2014-11-27 }}</ref>
The [[Crust (geology)|crust]], which currently forms the Earth's land, was created when the molten outer layer of the planet Earth cooled [[Phase transition|to form]] a solid mass as the accumulated water vapor began to act in the atmosphere. Once land became capable of supporting life, biodiversity evolved over hundreds of million years, expanding continually except when punctuated by mass extinctions.<ref name="SahneyBentonFerry2010">{{cite journal | url=http://rsbl.royalsocietypublishing.org/content/6/4/544.full.pdf+html | author=Sahney, S., Benton, M.J. and Ferry, P.A. | year=2010 | title=Links between global taxonomic diversity, ecological diversity and the expansion of vertebrates on land | journal=Biology Letters | doi=10.1098/rsbl.2009.1024 | volume=6 | pages=544–547 | format=PDF | issue=4 | pmid=20106856 | pmc=2936204 | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151106230121/http://rsbl.royalsocietypublishing.org/content/6/4/544.full.pdf+html | archivedate=2015-11-06 | df= }}</ref>
The two models<ref name=williams_santosh2004>{{cite book|first1=John James William|last1=Rogers|last2=Santosh|first2=M.|year=2004|title=Continents and Supercontinents|page=48|publisher=Oxford University Press US|isbn=978-0195165890}}</ref> that explain land mass propose either a steady growth to the present-day forms<ref name=science164_1229>{{cite journal|last1=Hurley|first1=P.M.|last2=Rand|first2=J.R.|date=Jun 1969|title=Pre-drift continental nuclei|journal=Science|volume=164 |pages=1229–1242|doi=10.1126/science.164.3885.1229|pmid=17772560|issue=3885 |bibcode = 1969Sci...164.1229H }}</ref> or, more likely, a rapid growth<ref name=tp322_19>{{cite journal|doi=10.1016/S0040-1951(00)00055-X|title=Early formation and long-term stability of continents resulting from decompression melting in a convecting mantle|year=2000|last1=De Smet|first1=J.|journal=Tectonophysics|volume=322|issue=1–2|page=19|bibcode=2000Tectp.322...19D|last2=Van Den Berg|first2=A.P.|last3=Vlaar|first3=N.J.|hdl=1874/1653}}</ref> early in Earth history<ref name=rg6_175>{{cite journal|last1=Armstrong|first1=R.L.|year=1968|title=A model for the evolution of strontium and lead isotopes in a dynamic earth| journal=Reviews of Geophysics|volume=6|issue=2|pages=175–199|doi=10.1029/RG006i002p00175|bibcode=1968RvGSP...6..175A}}</ref> followed by a long-term steady continental area.<ref name=science310_5754_1671>{{cite journal|last1=Kleine|first1=Thorsten|last2=Palme|first2=Herbert|last3=Mezger|first3=Klaus|last4=Halliday|first4=Alex N.|title=Hf-W Chronometry of Lunar Metals and the Age and Early Differentiation of the Moon|journal=Science|volume=310|issue=5754|date=2005-11-24|pages=1671–1674|doi=10.1126/science.1118842|pmid=16308422|bibcode = 2005Sci...310.1671K }}</ref><ref name=jaes23_799>{{cite journal|doi=10.1016/S1367-9120(03)00134-2|title=Continental crustal growth and the supercontinental cycle: evidence from the Central Asian Orogenic Belt|year=2004|last1=Hong|first1=D.|journal=Journal of Asian Earth Sciences|volume=23|issue=5|page=799|bibcode = 2004JAESc..23..799H|last2=Zhang|first2=Jisheng|last3=Wang|first3=Tao|last4=Wang|first4=Shiguang|last5=Xie|first5=Xilin }}</ref><ref name=ajes38_613>{{cite journal|last1=Armstrong|first1=R.L.|year=1991|title=The persistent myth of crustal growth|journal=Australian Journal of Earth Sciences|volume=38|issue=5|pages=613–630|doi=10.1080/08120099108727995|bibcode = 1991AuJES..38..613A |citeseerx=10.1.1.527.9577}}</ref> Continents formed by [[plate tectonics]], a process ultimately driven by the continuous loss of heat from the Earth's interior. On [[Geologic time scale|time scales]] lasting hundreds of millions of years, the [[supercontinent]]s have formed and broken apart three times. Roughly {{val|750|ul=mya}} (million years ago), one of the earliest known supercontinents, [[Rodinia]], began to break apart. The continents later recombined to form [[Pannotia]], 600–{{val|540|u=mya}}, then finally [[Pangaea]], which also broke apart {{val|180|u=mya}}.<ref name=as92_324>{{cite journal|last1=Murphy|first1=J.B.|last2=Nance|first2=R.D.|title=How do supercontinents assemble?|journal=American Scientist|year=1965|volume=92|issue=4|pages=324–333|url=http://scienceweek.com/2004/sa040730-5.htm|accessdate=2007-03-05|doi=10.1511/2004.4.324|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070713194319/http://scienceweek.com/2004/sa040730-5.htm|archivedate=2007-07-13|df=}}</ref>
== Land mass == {{Redirect|Landmass|the ambient album by Steve Roach|Landmass (album)}} "Land mass" refers to the total [[surface area|surface]] [[area]] of the land of a geographical [[region]] or [[country]] (which may include discontinuous pieces of land such as [[island]]s). It is written as two words to distinguish it from the usage "landmass", the contiguous area of land surrounded by [[ocean]]. [[Earth]]'s total land mass is approximately {{convert|148,939,063.133|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} which is about 29.2% of its total surface. Water covers approximately 70.8% of Earth's surface, mainly in the form of [[ocean]]s and ice formations.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.oceanicinstitute.org/aboutoceans/aquafacts.html|title=Aqua Facts|publisher=Hawai'i Pacific University Oceanic Institute}}</ref>

==Cultural perspectives== {{main article|Earth in culture}} [[Creation myth]]s in many [[religion]]s recall a story involving the creation of the world by a supernatural [[deity]] or deities, including accounts wherein the land is separated from the oceans and the air. The Earth itself has often been personified as a [[deity]], in particular a [[goddess]]. In many cultures, the [[mother goddess]] is also portrayed as a [[Fertility god|fertility deity]]. To the [[Aztec]]s, Earth was called ''[[Tonantzin]]''—"our mother"; to the [[Incas]], Earth was called ''[[Pachamama]]''—"mother earth". The Chinese Earth goddess [[Hou Tu]]<ref>{{cite book | first=E.T.C. | last=Werner | year=1922 | title=Myths & Legends of China | publisher=George G. Harrap & Co. Ltd. | location=New York | url=http://www.gutenberg.org/etext/15250 | accessdate=2007-03-14 }}</ref> is similar to [[Gaia (mythology)|Gaia]], the Greek goddess personifying the Earth. [[Bhumi Devi|Bhuma Devi]] is the goddess of Earth in [[Hinduism]], influenced by [[Graha]]. In [[Norse mythology]], the Earth giantess [[Jörð]] was the mother of [[Thor]] and the daughter of [[Annar]]. [[Ancient Egyptian religion|Ancient Egyptian mythology]] is different from that of other cultures because Earth ([[Geb]]) is male and sky ([[Nut (goddess)|Nut]]) is female.
In the past, there were varying levels of belief in a [[flat Earth]]. The Jewish conception of a flat earth is found in both biblical and post-biblical times.<ref group=note>The picture of the universe in Talmudic texts has the Earth in the center of creation with heaven as a hemisphere spread over it. Biblical writings, such as the Genesis creation story and the various Psalms that extol the firmament, the stars, the sun, and the earth, give similar explanations. The Hebrews saw the earth as an almost flat surface consisting of a solid and a liquid part and the sky as the realm of light in which heavenly bodies move. The earth rested on cornerstones and could not be moved except by Jehovah (as in an earthquake). According to the Hebrews, the sun and the moon were only a short distance from one another. "Cosmology." Encyclopedia Americana. Grolier Online, 2012. Author: Giorgio Abetti, Astrophysical Observatory of Arcetri-Firenze.</ref>{{pov-inline|date=May 2017}}<ref group=note>The Earth is usually described as a disk encircled by water. Cosmological and metaphysical speculations were not to be cultivated in public nor were they to be committed to writing. Rather, they were considered to be "secrets of the Torah not to be passed on to all and sundry" (Ketubot 112a). While study of God's creation was not prohibited, speculations about "what is above, what is beneath, what is before, and what is after" (Mishnah Hagigah: 2) were restricted to the intellectual elite. (Topic Overview: Judaism, Encyclopedia of Science and Religion, Ed. J. Wentzel Vrede van Huyssteen. Vol. 2. New York: Macmillan Reference, 2003. pp. 477–483. Hava Tirosh-Samuelson).</ref>{{pov-inline|date=May 2017}}[[Image:Baylonianmaps.JPG|right|thumb|''[[Babylonian Map of the World|Imago Mundi]]'' Babylonian map, the oldest known world map, 6th century BC [[Babylonia]].]]
In early Egyptian<ref>H. and H.A. Frankfort, J.A. Wilson, and T. Jacobsen, Before Philosophy (Baltimore: Penguin, 1949) 54.</ref> and [[Mesopotamian mythology|Mesopotamian thought]], the world was portrayed as a flat disk floating in the ocean. The Egyptian universe was pictured as a rectangular box with a north-south orientation and with a slightly concave surface, with Egypt in the center. A similar model is found in the [[Homeric]] account of the 8th century BC in which "Okeanos, the personified body of water surrounding the circular surface of the Earth, is the begetter of all life and possibly of all gods."<ref> {{Cite book|author=Anthony Gottlieb|title=The Dream of Reason|year=2000|page=6|publisher=Penguin|isbn=978-0393049510}}</ref> The [[Biblical cosmology#Earth|biblical earth]] is a flat disc floating on water.<ref name="Berlin 2011 189">{{cite book |last1 = Berlin |first1 = Adele |authorlink = |title = The Oxford Dictionary of the Jewish Religion |chapter = Cosmology and creation |editor1-last = Berlin |editor1-first = Adele |editor2-last = Grossman |editor2-first = Maxine |year = 2011 |publisher = Oxford University Press |isbn = 978-0199730049 |chapter-url = https://books.google.com/?id=hKAaJXvUaUoC&pg=PA189&dq=Bible+Cosmology#v=onepage&q=Bible%20Cosmology&f=false |ref = harv |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160611032518/https://books.google.com/books?id=hKAaJXvUaUoC&pg=PA189&dq=Bible+Cosmology&hl=en&sa=X&ei=jvHuTu_wDcStiQeFz62dBw&ved=0CGcQ6AEwCTgo#v=onepage&q=Bible%20Cosmology&f=false |archivedate = 2016-06-11 |df = }}</ref>
The [[Pyramid Texts]] and [[Coffin Texts]] reveal that the ancient Egyptians believed [[Nu (mythology)|Nun]] (the ocean) was a circular body surrounding ''nbwt'' (a term meaning "dry lands" or "islands"), and therefore believed in a similar Ancient Near Eastern circular Earth cosmography surrounded by water.<ref>''Pyramid Texts'', Utterance 366, 629a–629c: "Behold, thou art great and round like the Great Round; Behold, thou are bent around, and art round like the Circle which encircles the nbwt; Behold, thou art round and great like the Great Circle which sets."''(Faulkner 1969, 120)''</ref><ref>''Ancient Near Eastern Texts'', Pritchard, 1969, p. 374.</ref><ref>''Coffin Texts'', Spell 714.</ref>
The spherical form of the Earth was suggested by early [[Greek philosophers]], a belief espoused by [[Pythagoras]]. Contrary to popular belief, most people in the [[Middle Ages]] did not believe the Earth was flat: this misconception is often called the "[[Myth of the Flat Earth]]". As evidenced by thinkers such as [[Thomas Aquinas]], the European belief in a [[spherical Earth]] was widespread by this point in time.<ref>{{cite web | last = Russell | first = Jeffrey B. | url = http://www.asa3.org/ASA/topics/history/1997Russell.html | title = The Myth of the Flat Earth | publisher = American Scientific Affiliation | accessdate = 2007-03-14 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/617EnVfVa?url=http://www.asa3.org/ASA/topics/history/1997Russell.html | archivedate = 2011-08-22 | df = }}; but see also [[Cosmas Indicopleustes]]</ref> Prior to circumnavigation of the planet and the introduction of [[space flight]], belief in a spherical Earth was based on observations of the secondary effects of the Earth's shape and parallels drawn with the shape of other planets.<ref>{{cite web |last = Jacobs |first = James Q. |date = 1998-02-01 |url = http://www.jqjacobs.net/astro/aegeo.html |title = Archaeogeodesy, a Key to Prehistory |accessdate = 2007-04-21 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/617Eny1Xn?url=http://www.jqjacobs.net/astro/aegeo.html |archivedate = 2011-08-22 |df = }}</ref>
==Extraterrestrial land== Most planets known to humans are either gaseous [[Jovian planets]] or solid [[terrestrial planets]]. Terrestrial planets include [[Mercury (planet)|Mercury]], [[Venus]], [[Earth]], and [[Mars]]. These inner planets have a rocky surface with metal interiors.<ref>NASA Solar System Exploration [https://solarsystem.nasa.gov/multimedia/display.cfm?IM_ID=168 Terrestrial Planet Interiors] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402105322/https://solarsystem.nasa.gov/multimedia/display.cfm?IM_ID=168 |date=2015-04-02 }}</ref> The Jovian planets consist of [[Jupiter]], [[Saturn]], [[Uranus]], and [[Neptune]]. While these planets are larger, their only land surface is a small rocky core surrounded by a large, thick atmosphere.<ref>NASA [http://amazing-space.stsci.edu/resources/print/lithos/jovianplanets.pdf The Jovian Planets] {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/6YLhNKGil?url=http://amazing-space.stsci.edu/resources/print/lithos/jovianplanets.pdf |date=2015-05-07 }}</ref> The [[gas giant]]s, Jupiter and Saturn, are thought to have surface layers composed of [[liquid hydrogen]] rather than solid land; however, their [[planetary geology]] is not well understood. The possibility of Uranus and Neptune (the [[ice giant]]s) possessing hot, highly compressed, supercritical water<!-- {{efn|name=pressures}} --> under their thick atmospheres has been hypothesised. While their composition is still not fully understood, a 2006 study by Wiktorowicz et al. ruled out the possibility of such a water "ocean" existing on Neptune,<ref name="WiktorowiczIngersoll2007">{{cite journal|last1=Wiktorowicz|first1=Sloane J.|last2=Ingersoll|first2=Andrew P.|title=Liquid water oceans in ice giants|journal=Icarus|volume=186|issue=2|year=2007|pages=436–447|issn=0019-1035|doi=10.1016/j.icarus.2006.09.003|arxiv = astro-ph/0609723 |bibcode = 2007Icar..186..436W }}</ref> though some studies have suggested that exotic oceans of liquid diamond are possible.<ref name="Silvera2010">{{cite journal|last1=Silvera|first1=Isaac|title=Diamond: Molten under pressure|journal=Nature Physics|volume=6|issue=1|year=2010|pages=9–10|issn=1745-2473|doi=10.1038/nphys1491|bibcode = 2010NatPh...6....9S |url=http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:HUL.InstRepos:9121282}}</ref> The entire surface of a rocky planet or moon is considered land, even with a lack of seas or oceans for contrast. Planetary bodies that have a thin atmosphere often have land that is marked by impact craters since atmospheric conditions would normally break-down incoming objects and erode rough impact sites.<ref>NASA [http://sservi.nasa.gov/articles/how-are-craters-formed/ How are craters formed] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402114424/http://sservi.nasa.gov/articles/how-are-craters-formed/ |date=2015-04-02 }}</ref> Land on planetary bodies other than Earth can also be bought and sold although ownership of [[extraterrestrial real estate]] is not recognized by any authority.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lunarembassy.com|title=Lunar Embassy|work=lunarembassy.com|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150407193257/http://lunarembassy.com/|archivedate=2015-04-07|df=}}</ref>
==Land and climate== The land of the Earth interacts with and influences [[climate]] heavily since the surface of the land heats up and cools down faster than air or water.<ref name="PBS Learning Media">PBS Learning Media [http://www.pbslearningmedia.org/resource/ttv10.sci.ess.land/the-effect-of-land-masses-on-climate/ The Effect of Land Masses on Climate] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402092309/http://www.pbslearningmedia.org/resource/ttv10.sci.ess.land/the-effect-of-land-masses-on-climate/ |date=2015-04-02 }}</ref> [[Latitude]], [[elevation]], [[topography]], [[reflectivity]], and [[land use]] all have varying effects. The latitude of the land will influence how much [[solar radiation]] reaches the surface. High latitudes receive less solar radiation than low latitudes.<ref name="PBS Learning Media" /> The height of the land is important in creating and transforming airflow and [[precipitation]] on Earth. Large landforms, such as mountain ranges, divert wind energy and make the air parcel less dense and able to hold less heat.<ref name="PBS Learning Media" /> As air rises, this cooling effect causes [[condensation]] and [[precipitation]]. Reflectivity of the earth is called planetary [[albedo]] and the type of land cover that receives energy from the sun affects the amount of energy that is reflected or transferred to Earth.<ref name="Alan Betts: Atmospheric Research">Alan Betts: Atmospheric Research [http://alanbetts.com/understanding-climate-change/question/the-climate-energy-balance-of-the-earth/ The Climate Energy Balance of the Earth] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150305041546/http://alanbetts.com/understanding-climate-change/question/the-climate-energy-balance-of-the-earth |date=2015-03-05 }}</ref> [[Vegetation]] has a relatively low albedo meaning that vegetated surfaces are good absorbers of the sun’s energy. [[Forests]] have an albedo of 10–15% while [[grasslands]] have an albedo of 15–20%. In comparison, sandy [[deserts]] have an albedo of 25–40%.<ref name="Alan Betts: Atmospheric Research"/> Land use by humans also plays a role in the regional and global climate. Densely populated cities are warmer and create [[urban heat islands]] that have effects on the precipitation, cloud cover, and temperature of the region.<ref name="PBS Learning Media" />
==Notes== {{reflist|group=note}}
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== {{wiktionary|land}} {{wikiquote}} {{commons category|Landforms}} * [http://www.geomorph.org/ International Association of Geomorphologists] * [http://www.physicalgeography.net/ PhysicalGeography.net educational website]
{{Natural resources}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}}{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of accolades received by ''Up''}} {| class="infobox" style="width: 25em; text-align: left; font-size: 90%; vertical-align: middle;" |+ '''List of accolades received by ''Up''''' |- | colspan="3" style="text-align:center;" |[[File:Flickr - nicogenin - 66ème Festival de Venise (Mostra) - Pixar (3).jpg|170px|upright|alt=The portrait of a man holding a white telephone. He is wearing a striped brown shirt.]]
[[Pete Docter]] won the [[Academy Award for Best Animated Feature]]. |- | colspan=3 | {| class="collapsible collapsed" width=100% ! colspan=3 style="background-color: #D9E8FF; text-align: center;" | Accolades |- |- style="background:#d9e8ff; text-align:center;" | style="text-align:center;" | '''Award''' | style="text-align:center; background:#cec; text-size:0.9em; width:50px;"| '''Won''' | style="text-align:center; background:#fcd; text-size:0.9em; width:50px;"| '''Nominated''' |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Academy Award]]s |{{won|2}} |{{nom|5}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Annie Award]]s |{{won|2}} |{{nom|9}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Casting Society of America|Artios Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Austin Film Critics Association|Austin Film Critics Association Awards]] |{{won|2}} |{{nom|2}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[British Academy Film Awards|BAFTA Awards]] |{{won|2}} |{{nom|4}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Awards|Blimper Award]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Chicago Film Critics Association|Chicago Film Critics Association Awards]] |{{won|2}} |{{nom|3}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Broadcast Film Critics Association|Critics' Choice Awards]] |{{won|2}} |{{nom|4}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association|Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[American Cinema Editors|Eddie Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Florida Film Critics Circle|Florida Film Critics Circle Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Golden Globe Award]]s |{{won|2}} |{{nom|2}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Motion Picture Sound Editors|Golden Reel Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Rotten Tomatoes|Golden Tomatoes Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Grammy Award]]s |{{won|2}} |{{nom|3}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Hugo Award]]s |{{won|0}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Irish Film and Television Awards]] |{{won|0}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;Kansas City Film Critics Circle Awards |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Producers Guild of America|Motion Picture Producer of the Year Award]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|2}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[National Board of Review of Motion Pictures|National Board of Review Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Online Film Critics Society|Online Film Critics Society Awards]] |{{won|2}} |{{nom|4}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Palm Dog Award]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;Phoenix Film Critics Society Awards |{{won|3}} |{{nom|3}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Satellite Award]]s |{{won|0}} |{{nom|3}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Saturn Award]]s |{{won|0}} |{{nom|2}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Visual Effects Society]] |{{won|3}} |{{nom|3}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;Southeastern Film Critics Association Awards |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Teen Choice Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|1}} |- | style="text-align:center;"| ;[[Washington D.C. Area Film Critics Association|Washington D.C. Area Film Critics Association Awards]] |{{won|1}} |{{nom|3}} |} |- style="background:#d9e8ff;" | style="text-align:center;" colspan="3"| ;'''Total number of awards and nominations''' |- |{{won|'''Totals'''}} |{{won|'''38'''}} |{{nom|'''66'''}} |- style="background:#d9e8ff;" | colspan="3" style="font-size: smaller; text-align:center;" | [[#References|References]] |} ''[[Up (2009 film)|Up]]'' is a 2009 [[Computer animation|computer-animated]] [[film]] produced by [[Pixar|Pixar Animation Studios]] and released by [[Walt Disney Pictures]]. The film, which premiered on May 29, 2009, in [[North America]], became the first animated 3D film to open the [[2009 Cannes Film Festival|Cannes Film Festival]].{{cite news |title=Disney/Pixar's Up to Open Cannes |work=CraveOnline |publisher= AtomicOnline, LLC |date=March 19, 2009 |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=53820 |accessdate=August 10, 2010}} It was directed by [[Pete Docter]], co-directed by [[Bob Peterson (animator)|Bob Peterson]], and produced by [[Jonas Rivera]].{{cite web |url=http://adisney.go.com/disneyvideos/animatedfilms/up/main.html#/epk/about/film_makers |title=Up: The Official Website |publisher=The Walt Disney Company |work=Up Official Website |accessdate=August 10, 2010}} The film centers on an elderly widower, named Carl Fredricksen, and a young [[Scouting in popular culture|Wilderness Explorer]], named Russell, who fly to South America in a house suspended by helium balloons. The movie received both critical acclaim and box office success, opening in 3,766 theaters in the US, debuting at number one with $68,108,790 and grossing over $731 million worldwide.{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=up.htm |title=Up (2009) |publisher= Amazon Inc |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=August 10, 2010}} It garnered various awards and nominations, most of them in the Best Animated Picture category and for the [[Up (film score)|film's score]]. ''Up'' was nominated for five [[Academy Award]]s at the [[82nd Academy Awards|2010 Ceremony]], winning two, for [[Academy Award for Best Animated Feature|Best Animated Feature]] and for [[Academy Award for Best Original Score|Best Original Score]]. It was the second fully animated film to be nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Picture]]; the other was ''[[Beauty and the Beast (1991 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'' (1991).{{cite web |url=http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/35196951 |title=Things looking ‘Up’ for best picture race |first=Courtney |last=Hazlett |date=February 2, 2010 |work=msnbc.com |publisher= NBC Universal |accessdate=August 10, 2010 }} ''Up'' became the third consecutive Pixar film to win the Academy Award for Animated Feature, after ''[[Ratatouille (film)|Ratatouille]]'' and ''[[WALL-E]]''.{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2010/03/07/oscars-awards-gala.html |date=March 8, 2010 |accessdate=August 10, 2010 |work=CBC News |publisher=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation |title=Hurt Locker triumphs at Oscars}} The film also won the [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe]] for Best Original Score and the Best Animated Feature Film at the [[67th Golden Globe Awards]]. It received the Golden Tomato, from the website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], for highest rating feature in 2009, with an approval of 98 percent from film critics, based on 259 reviews.{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/guides/rtawards/wide/ |title=Up Movie Reviews, Pictures |work=Rotten Tomatoes |publisher=Flixster Inc |accessdate=August 10, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100323003235/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/guides/rtawards/wide/ |archivedate=March 23, 2010 |df=mdy-all }} The movie received nine nominations for the [[Annie Award]]s in eight categories, winning two awards for Best Animated Feature and Best Directing in a Feature Production. It also was selected as the Summer Movie Comedy at the 2009 [[Teen Choice Awards]], and was also nominated for three [[Grammy Award|Grammys]] at [[52nd Grammy Awards]], winning two of them. Rivera received the Motion Pictures Motion Picture Producer of the Year Award, for Animated Theatrical Motion Pictures, given by the [[Producers Guild of America]], while Docter, Peterson and Giacchino were honored with [[British Academy of Film and Television Arts]] (BAFTA) awards for their work on the film. Furthermore, the film was nominated at the [[Satellite Awards 2009|2009 Satellite Awards]] in the categories for Best Animated or Mixed Media Film, Best Original Screenplay and Best Original Score. ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! colspan="5" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | Awards |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! List of incidents at Walt Disney World

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2017}} {{use American English|date=March 2017}} This is a summary of notable '''incidents that have taken place at [[Walt Disney World]]''' in Florida. Several people have died or been injured while riding attractions at Walt Disney World theme parks. Since 2001, Disney has been required to report incidents to state authorities. For example, from the first quarter of 2005 to the first quarter of 2006, Disney reported four deaths and nineteen injuries at its Florida parks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.floridatoday.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20060712/BUSINESS/607120351/1003 |title=Report on 2005–2006 incidents |publisher=Floridatoday.com |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150220062706/http://www.floridatoday.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20060712%2FBUSINESS%2F607120351%2F1003 |archivedate=February 20, 2015 |df= }}</ref>
The term ''incident'' refers to major injury, injuries, deaths, and significant crimes. While these incidents are required to be reported to regulatory authorities for investigation, attraction-related incidents usually fall into one of these following categories: * Negligence on the part of the park, either by ride operator or maintenance. * Caused by negligence on the part of the guest. This can be refusal to follow specific ride safety instructions, or deliberate intent to break park rules. * The result of a guest's known, or unknown, health issues. * [[Act of God]] or a generic accident (e.g. slipping and falling) that is not a direct result of an action on anyone's part.
According to a 1985 ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine article, nearly 100 lawsuits are filed against Disney each year for various incidents.<ref name="Time1985">{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,962597,00.html |title=No Mickey Mousing Around |work=Time magazine |date=March 11, 1985 |accessdate=December 18, 2006 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080120173014/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0%2C9171%2C962597%2C00.html |archivedate=January 20, 2008 |df= }}</ref> Florida theme parks are required to notify the state of any ride-related injuries or illnesses that require a hospital stay of at least 24 hours.<ref name="june2018report"/> {{TOC limit|limit=2}}
==Disney Transport== {{main|Disney Transport}}
===Bus=== * On March 23, 2010, a Disney transportation bus rear-ended a private charter bus near the entrance to the [[Epcot]] parking lot. Seven guests aboard the Disney bus received minor injuries, while the bus driver was reported to have received critical injuries.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/22921408/detail.html |title=8 Injured In Disney Bus Crash Near Epcot |publisher=WFTV |date=March 23, 2010 |accessdate=March 23, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100326105121/http://www.wftv.com/news/22921408/detail.html |archivedate=March 26, 2010 |df= }}</ref> * On April 1, 2010, a 9-year-old boy was crushed to death by a Disney transportation bus at [[Disney's Fort Wilderness Resort & Campground]] while he was riding his bicycle with an 11-year-old friend.<ref name="USAToday0402">{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2010-04-01-Disney_N.htm |title=9-year-old boy killed by Disney bus in Fla. |agency=Associated Press |publisher=USAToday |date=April 2, 2010 |accessdate=October 21, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101029001246/http://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2010-04-01-Disney_N.htm |archivedate=October 29, 2010 |df= }}</ref> A report from the [[Florida Highway Patrol]] says that the victim appeared to turn his bike into the road and ran into the side of the bus, subsequently being dragged under the bus's right-rear tire.<ref name="USAToday0402"/> The victim was pronounced dead at the scene.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wesh.com/entertainment/23026301/detail.html |title=Boy Killed In Disney Bus Crash Was Riding Bike |publisher=WESH2 |date=April 1, 2010 |accessdate=April 1, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100403022841/http://www.wesh.com/entertainment/23026301/detail.html |archivedate=April 3, 2010 |df= }}</ref> A preliminary report stated that the bus driver, who has 30 years' experience with Disney, was not impaired or driving recklessly and that charges probably would not be filed, pending a full investigation of the incident.<ref name="USAToday0402"/> In October 2010, [[Walt Disney World|Disney World]] was sued for $15,106 by the boy's mother.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedailydisney.com/blog/2010/10/disney-world-sued-by-mom-of-boy-killed-in-bus-accident/ |title=Disney World sued by mom of boy killed in bus accident |publisher=The Daily Disney |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101014210410/http://thedailydisney.com/blog/2010/10/disney-world-sued-by-mom-of-boy-killed-in-bus-accident/ |archive-date=October 14, 2010 |first=Jason |last=Garcia |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Disney settled out of court in 2012 with the boy's mother.<ref>{{cite web |title=Mom of Pinellas boy struck by Disney bus settles suit |url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/publicsafety/accidents/mom-of-pinellas-boy-struck-by-disney-bus-settles-suit/1250659 |website=Tampa Bay Times |accessdate=29 October 2018}}</ref> * On December 26, 2010, a 69-year-old man died after stepping in front of a moving Disney transportation bus in the parking lot of [[Disney's Port Orleans Resort]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nickortizlaw.com/69-year-old-man-killed-in-bus-accident-at-disney-resort-parking-lot/ |title=8 69 Year Old Man Killed in Bus Accident at Disney Resort Parking Lot |publisher=Ortiz Law Firm |date=January 16, 2014 |accessdate=January 16, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117112306/http://www.nickortizlaw.com/69-year-old-man-killed-in-bus-accident-at-disney-resort-parking-lot/ |archivedate=January 17, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===Monorail=== {{Main|Walt Disney World Monorail System}} * On February 12, 1974, The Mark IV Monorail Blue rear ended the Mark IV Monorail Red due to driver error. One driver and two passengers were injured.<ref> {{cite news |title=Monorail Trains Collide |work=Eugene Register |date=February 13, 1974 |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=ugUTAAAAIBAJ&sjid=A9gDAAAAIBAJ&dq=monorail%20disney&pg=4923%2C2531859 |accessdate=July 6, 2009 |page=3A}}</ref> * On June 26, 1985, a fire engulfed the rear car of the six-car [[Mark IV monorail|Mark IV]] Silver monorail train in transit from the [[Epcot]] station to the Transportation and Ticket Center.<ref name="OSNarc">{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/results.html?st=basic&QryTxt=Disney%2Cmonorail%2Cfire |title=The Orlando Sentinel News Paper |accessdate=May 14, 2007 |work=Archive |publisher=The Orlando Sentinel News Paper |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927221004/https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/results.html?st=basic&QryTxt=Disney%2Cmonorail%2Cfire |archivedate=September 27, 2007 |df= }}</ref> This fire pre-dated onboard fire detection systems, emergency exits and evacuation planning. Passengers in the car kicked out side windows and climbed around the side of the train to reach the roof, where they were subsequently rescued by the [[Reedy Creek Improvement District|Reedy Creek]] Fire Department.<ref name="OS27Jun1985">{{cite news |last=Levenson |first=Bob |title=200 escape fire aboard monorail Disney World passengers climb to roof |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=June 27, 1985 |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/91759037.html?dids=91759037:91759037&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Jun+27%2C+1985&author=Bob+Levenson+of+The+Sentinel+Staff&pub=Orlando+Sentinel&edition=&startpage=A.1&desc=200+ESCAPE+FIRE+ABOARD+MONORAIL+DISNEY+WORLD+PASSENGERS+CLIMB+TO+SAFETY+ON+ROOF |accessdate=March 30, 2008}}</ref> Seven passengers were hospitalized for smoke inhalation or other minor injuries.<ref name="OS28Jun1985">{{cite news|last=Gandhi |first=Prakash |title=Disney Fire: "It Could Have Been Worse" |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=June 28, 1985 |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/91759605.html?FMT=ABS |accessdate=July 16, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927220436/https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/91759605.html?FMT=ABS |archivedate=September 27, 2007 |df= }}</ref> The fire department later determined that the fire started when a flat tire was dragged across the concrete beam and was ignited by the frictional heat.<ref name="OS04Jul1985">{{cite news|last=Trager |first=Louis |title=Report Blames Tire Friction for Fire on Disney Monorail |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=July 4, 1985 |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/91765902.html?FMT=ABS |accessdate=July 16, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927220447/https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/91765902.html?FMT=ABS |archivedate=September 27, 2007 |df= }}</ref> * On August 30, 1991, Monorail Red collided with a diesel maintenance work tractor near the Contemporary Resort as the tractor drove closely in front of the train to film it for a commercial. Two employees were treated at a hospital for injuries.<ref name="OS1991"> {{cite news|title=Monorail Bumps Platform – 2 Disney Workers Hurt |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=August 31, 1991 |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/88995385.html?FMT=ABS |accessdate=July 16, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930181536/https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/88995385.html?FMT=ABS |archivedate=September 30, 2007 |df= }}</ref> * On August 12, 1996, an electrical fire occurred on a train pulling into the Magic Kingdom station. The driver and the five passengers on board exited safely. Two bus drivers who witnessed the fire and assisted were overcome by smoke and treated at a nearby hospital.<ref name="OS1996"> {{cite news|title=Disney Monorail Fire Injures 2 Workers |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=August 13, 1996 |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/77833071.html?FMT=ABS |accessdate=July 17, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930201805/https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/77833071.html?FMT=ABS |archivedate=September 30, 2007 |df= }}</ref> * On July 5, 2009, during a failed track switchover from the Epcot line onto the Magic Kingdom express line, Monorail Pink backed into Monorail Purple at the Transportation & Ticket Center station, killing the 21-year-old Monorail Purple pilot.<ref name="weshmon">{{cite news|url=http://www.wesh.com/news/19955188/detail.html |title=1 Dead in Disney World Monorail Crash |publisher=WESH |accessdate=July 5, 2009 |date=July 5, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090707003327/http://www.wesh.com/news/19955188/detail.html |archivedate=July 7, 2009 |df= }}</ref> One employee and six guests who were also on the trains were treated at the scene and released.<ref>{{cite news|title=Deadly Disney Crash Investigated |publisher=WMKG Local News |date=July 6, 2009 |url=http://www.clickorlando.com/news/19954891/detail.html |accessdate=July 5, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090708083051/http://www.clickorlando.com/news/19954891/detail.html |archivedate=July 8, 2009 |df= }}</ref> [[Occupational Safety and Health Administration|OSHA]] and park officials inspected the monorail line and the monorail reopened on July 6, 2009, after new sensors and operating procedures were put in place.<ref name="monreop">{{cite news |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/orl-bk-disney-world-monorail-crash-070609,0,5007407.story |title=Disney World will reopen monorail – with extra safety features |first=Jason |last=Garcia |date=July 6, 2009 |accessdate=July 6, 2009 |publisher=Orlando Sentinel}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/orl-bk-disney-monorail-changes-070909,0,3236758.story |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |title=Disney Monorail Crash: Disney's monorail procedures changed in years leading up to accident |first=Jason |last=Garcia |date=July 9, 2009 |accessdate=July 10, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090711122913/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/orl-bk-disney-monorail-changes-070909%2C0%2C3236758.story |archivedate=July 11, 2009 |df= }}</ref> An investigation by the [[National Transportation Safety Board]] (NTSB) showed no mechanical problems with the trains or track but did find that the track used in the switchover was not in its proper place for the track transition. The NTSB also noted that Purple's pilot attempted to reverse his train when he saw that there was going to be a collision. Disney placed three monorail employees on paid administrative leave as a result of the incident.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=CNN |url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/US/07/09/florida.disney.crash/ |title=Disney monorail workers placed on leave after crash |first=Rich |last=Phillips |date=July 9, 2009 |accessdate=July 10, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090715193617/http://www.cnn.com/2009/US/07/09/florida.disney.crash/ |archivedate=July 15, 2009 |df= }}</ref> On October 31, 2011, the NTSB issued its findings on this incident, citing the probable cause as the shop panel operator's failure to properly align the switch beam before the monorail train was directed to reverse through it. As a result of this incident, guests are no longer allowed to ride in the cab of the monorail.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntsb.gov/investigations/AccidentReports/Pages/RAB1107.aspx |title=Railroad Accident Brief – Collision of Two Monorails in Walt Disney World Resort |date=October 31, 2011 |publisher=National Transportation Safety Board |accessdate=October 31, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150103191913/http://www.ntsb.gov/investigations/AccidentReports/Pages/RAB1107.aspx |archivedate=January 3, 2015 |df= }}</ref> * On July 13, 2014, due to a power failure possibly caused by a lightning strike, the monorail system was temporarily disabled. Most trains were restarted and returned to stations safely.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=Orlando Sentinel |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/breakingnews/os-epcot-monorail-evacuated-lightning-strike-20140713,0,1272231.story |title=Epcot monorail train evacuated after power failure |first=Lauren |last=Roth |date=July 13, 2014 |accessdate=July 13, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714225706/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/breakingnews/os-epcot-monorail-evacuated-lightning-strike-20140713%2C0%2C1272231.story |archivedate=July 14, 2014 |df= }}</ref> Disney cast members were unable to restart Monorail Gold, which had been heading toward Epcot when it broke down. Reedy Creek emergency personnel successfully evacuated 120 people from that train. Fire officials confirmed that the malfunction was weather-related.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=WESH TV |url=http://www.wesh.com/news/disney-world-monorail-evacuated-passengers-report-lightning-strike/26937720?absolute=true |title=Disney World monorail evacuated; Passengers report lightning strike |first=Kevin |last=Clay |date=July 13, 2014 |accessdate=July 13, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714113241/http://www.wesh.com/news/disney-world-monorail-evacuated-passengers-report-lightning-strike/26937720?absolute=true |archivedate=July 14, 2014 |df= }}</ref> * On October 10, 2015, a mechanical failure stranded guests aboard Monorail Yellow traveling between the Magic Kingdom and Disney's Contemporary Resort. Firefighters were able to rescue all the passengers about two hours after their arrival. No injuries were reported, although a number of the riders reported on social media that they had been stranded for hours.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/news/local/monorail-gets-stuck-disney-world-guest-evacuated/nnzNs/ |title=Disney World monorail gets stuck; passengers evacuated |work=wftv.com |publisher=Cox Media Group |date=October 10, 2015 |accessdate=October 12, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012181809/http://www.wftv.com/news/news/local/monorail-gets-stuck-disney-world-guest-evacuated/nnzNs/ |archivedate=October 12, 2015 |df= }}</ref> * On November 18, 2015, Monorail Coral was being towed by a monorail tug for an unknown reason. The monorail separated from the tug, then crashed into it, causing damage to the body of the monorail and shattering the windshield. All monorail lines were shut down after the accident and resumed operations the next day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wesh.com/news/disney-monorail-crashes-with-tow-vehicle-service-halted/36527276 |title=Disney Monorail damaged in crash with tow vehicle |first=Chris |last=Hush |date=November 18, 2015 |work=WESH |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151119165044/http://www.wesh.com/news/disney-monorail-crashes-with-tow-vehicle-service-halted/36527276 |archivedate=November 19, 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedisneyblog.com/2015/11/18/monorail-coral-suffers-damage-in-accident-at-walt-disney-world/ |title=Disney Monorail damaged in crash with tow vehicle |first=John |last=Frost |date=November 18, 2015 |work=The Disney Blog |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151122085946/http://thedisneyblog.com/2015/11/18/monorail-coral-suffers-damage-in-accident-at-walt-disney-world/ |archivedate=November 22, 2015 |df= }}</ref> * On June 16, 2017, a guest reported that a piece of metal and some other parts broke off Monorail Blue landing 10 feet away from him at the Amaze parking lot. Monorail Blue then came to a stop all the way down by the Transportation and Ticket Center. Guests reported seeing sparks and smoke coming out from under the monorail on social media. Disney brought in fire and rescue teams to attempt an evacuation. Instead, a tug pushed the monorail into the station so guests could unload. No guests were harmed in this incident.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thedisneyblog.com/2017/06/16/monorail-blue-loses-parts-becomes-stuck-walt-disney-world/ |title=Monorail Blue loses parts becomes stuck at Walt Disney World |date=June 16, 2017}}</ref> * On January 6, 2018, after departing the Transportation and Ticket Center, one of Monorail Red's doors opened unexpectedly during the middle of the journey. Three fail-safe systems were not activated. Nobody was injured, and Disney removed the train from service for inspection.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.wesh.com/article/video-appears-to-show-disney-monorail-traveling-with-doors-open/14854586|title=Video shows Disney monorail traveling with doors open|date=2018-01-09|work=WESH|access-date=2018-01-10|language=en}}</ref> *On June 10, 2018, Monorail Lime became disabled and the air conditioning failed. Guests pushed out windows for ventilation till a tractor came and towed it to a station. * On November 13, 2018, a door fell off Monorail Lime while at the Grand Floridian station. Disney officials reported the cause was due to being hit by a guest's motorized scooter. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fox35orlando.com/home/fallen-monorail-door-at-disney-seen-by-guests |title=Fallen Monorail door at Disney seen by guests |publisher=Fox35 |date=2018-11-13 }}</ref>
===Parking lot trams=== * On June 12, 1982, a 1-year-old girl from [[Muscatine, Iowa]], was killed when she fell from a tram in a parking lot.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1320&dat=19820613&id=tmdIAAAAIBAJ&sjid=qAYEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4224,4937746&hl=en|title=Tot Dies After Fall At Disney World|publisher=Gainesville Sun|date=Jun 13, 1982|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}</ref>
==Disney's Blizzard Beach== {{Main|Disney's Blizzard Beach}} * On March 16, 2007, a 51-year-old man from [[Pulaski, Mississippi]], collapsed near the Downhill Double Dipper water slide. He was pronounced dead on arrival at the local hospital. An autopsy showed that the victim died due to a [[heart attack]].<ref name="1Q2007Stat">{{cite news|url=http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/business_tourism_aviation/2007/04/disney_deaths_d.html |title=Disney deaths due to natural causes |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=April 18, 2007 |accessdate=April 18, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070425185418/http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/business_tourism_aviation/2007/04/disney_deaths_d.html |archivedate=April 25, 2007 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> His family has said that he had an early-stage existing [[heart disease|heart condition]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/orange/orl-disneydeath16x07mar16,0,5337517.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |title=Disney visitor collapses on water-park ride, dies |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=March 15, 2007 |accessdate=March 16, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070320020310/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/orange/orl-disneydeath16x07mar16%2C0%2C5337517.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |archivedate=March 20, 2007 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2007-03-17/news/MCFBRIEFS17_3_1_wicker-walt-disney-disney-world |title=Authorities ID water-park guest who died |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=March 17, 2007 |accessdate=October 28, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120908044253/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2007-03-17/news/MCFBRIEFS17_3_1_wicker-walt-disney-disney-world |archivedate=September 8, 2012 |df= }}</ref> * On June 10, 2018, a 71-year-old man collapsed as he exited the wave pool and died from natural causes. His death was contributed by [[Hypertensive heart disease|hypertensive cardiovascular disease]] and other medical conditions.<ref name="june2018report">{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-cfb-disney-injury-report-20180716-story.html|title=Florida theme parks document visitors' health problems in new report|author=Gabrielle Russon|publisher=Orlando Sentinel|date=2018-07-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Russon |first1=Gabrielle |title=Tourist's death at Disney's Blizzard Beach from natural causes, report says |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-bz-disney-blizzard-beach-20180809-story.html |website=Orlando Sentinel |accessdate=10 August 2018}}</ref>
==Disney's Animal Kingdom== * On January 28, 2016, an Orlando-area attorney announced that he had been retained by a family involved in a biting incident at the park. According to the attorney, in October 2014, a snake fell out of a tree onto a group of guests in a public area of the theme park. The animal bit an 8-year-old boy that it landed on, causing the boy's grandmother to suffer [[cardiac arrest]] and die two days later. The attorney claimed that the snake had escaped from the park's facilities, but Disney officials, while acknowledging the biting incident, stated that the snake was not part of their collection and was wild. They further stated that the snake involved was non-venomous, and that a park nurse treated the bite with an adhesive bandage and the family continued their visit afterwards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clickorlando.com/theme-parks/attorney-family-claims-snake-bit-boy-at-animal-kingdom-causing-grandmothers-death |title=Attorney for family who claims boy bitten by snake at Disney holds news conference |first=Daniel |last=Dahm |work=clickorlando.com |publisher=WKMG ClickOrlando |date=January 29, 2016 |accessdate=January 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160129081316/http://www.clickorlando.com/theme-parks/attorney-family-claims-snake-bit-boy-at-animal-kingdom-causing-grandmothers-death |archivedate=January 29, 2016 |df= }}</ref>
===Dinosaur=== {{Main|Dinosaur (Disney's Animal Kingdom)}} * On April 30, 2005, a 30-year-old man from [[Mooresville, Indiana]], lost consciousness shortly after exiting the ride and died from a heart attack moments later. An investigation showed the ride was operating correctly and was not the cause of his death; he had an [[artificial pacemaker]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sptimes.com/2005/07/23/news_pf/State/Report_notes_another_.shtml |title=Report notes another death after Disney ride |agency=Associated Press |date=July 23, 2005 |accessdate=July 26, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080121113357/http://www.sptimes.com/2005/07/23/news_pf/State/Report_notes_another_.shtml |archivedate=January 21, 2008 |df= }}</ref> * On May 29, 2013, a woman found a loaded [[pistol]] in a Dinosaur ride vehicle. The gun was reported to the ride attendant, who in turn reported the incident to authorities. The owner of the gun stated that he was unaware of Disney's policy against weapons and had a concealed weapons permit.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.yahoo.com/disney-world-patron-finds-gun-ride-204422359.html |title=Disney World patron finds gun on ride |agency=Associated Press |date=May 30, 2013 |accessdate=May 30, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130530045120/http://news.yahoo.com//disney-world-patron-finds-gun-ride-204422359.html |archivedate=May 30, 2013 |df= }}</ref>
===Expedition Everest=== {{Main|Expedition Everest}} * On December 18, 2007, a 44-year-old man from [[Navarre, Florida]], lost consciousness while riding the coaster. He was given [[Cardiopulmonary resuscitation|CPR]] on the ride's loading platform and was later pronounced dead at the hospital.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/travel/news/2007-12-18-roller-coaster-death_N.htm |title=Park visitor dies after riding Disney World roller coaster |publisher=USAToday |date=December 18, 2007 |accessdate=December 18, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080116224024/http://www.usatoday.com/travel/news/2007-12-18-roller-coaster-death_N.htm |archivedate=January 16, 2008 |df= }}</ref> An autopsy by the Orange County [[medical examiner]]'s office concluded that the victim died of [[dilated cardiomyopathy]] and that the death was considered natural.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2007-12-20/news/everest20_1_defibrillator-cardiac-arrhythmia-everest-ride |title=Disney World death on Everest roller coaster blamed on tourist's heart condition |work=tribunedigital-orlandosentinel |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304035740/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2007-12-20/news/everest20_1_defibrillator-cardiac-arrhythmia-everest-ride |archivedate=March 4, 2016 |df= }}</ref> * On May 19, 2018, a 26-year-old man suffered a seizure after riding the attraction.<ref name="june2018report"/>
===Kali River Rapids=== {{Main|Kali River Rapids}} * On May 29, 2007, five guests and one cast member were injured when an emergency exit platform malfunctioned. The guests were exiting a Kali River Rapids raft during a ride stoppage triggered by a monitoring [[security camera|sensor]]. The raft was on a steep incline and the emergency exit platform was designed to allow guests to easily access the emergency stairs from the incline. After an investigation determined that the platform "disengaged and slid", it was removed and an alternative evacuation procedure was adopted.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wesh.com/news/13405578/detail.html |title=6 Suffer Minor Injuries On Animal Kingdom Ride – Orlando News Story – WESH Orlando |publisher=Wesh.com |date=May 29, 2007 |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120314085824/http://www.wesh.com/news/13405578/detail.html |archivedate=March 14, 2012 |df= }}</ref> The six people were taken to local hospitals for minor injuries and were later released.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-bk-dizride052907,0,4415309.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |title=6 injured on Animal Kingdom ride at Disney released from hospitals |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=May 29, 2007 |accessdate=May 30, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070601165141/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-bk-dizride052907%2C0%2C4415309.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |archivedate=June 1, 2007 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===Kilimanjaro Safaris=== * In April 2018, a 27-year-old woman went into labor while riding the attraction.<ref name="june2018report"/>
===Primeval Whirl=== {{Main|Primeval Whirl}} * On November 27, 2007, a 63-year-old employee died from a brain injury sustained four days earlier when she was hit by a ride vehicle after falling from a restricted area of the ride platform.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-metcfbriefs29x_0207nov29,0,7938238.story?coll=orl_tab01_layout |title=Disney worker dies after falling from ride platform |date=November 29, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071202134048/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-metcfbriefs29x_0207nov29%2C0%2C7938238.story?coll=orl_tab01_layout |archivedate=December 2, 2007 |df= }}</ref> On May 23, 2008, OSHA fined Walt Disney World US$25,500 and charged the company with five safety violations. The fines were: $15,000 for three serious violations; $7,500 for still missing a handrail that had been reported; and $3,000 for not responding to OSHA requests within the requested time period.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/business_tourism_aviation/2008/05/osha-cites-fine.html |title=OSHA cites, fines Walt Disney World in fatal ride accident |date=May 24, 2008 |accessdate=May 26, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080528122159/http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/business_tourism_aviation/2008/05/osha-cites-fine.html |archivedate=May 28, 2008 |df= }}</ref> * On March 13, 2011, a 52-year-old employee sustained head injuries while working on the ride and was airlifted to a local hospital, where he later died. The ride was undergoing maintenance and was closed to the public at the time of the incident.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/march/218230/Cast-member-injured-at-Disney-Animal-Kingdoms-Primeval-Whirl |title=Disney cast member dies after injury at Animal Kingdom |work=Central Florida News 13 |publisher=[[Bright House Networks]] |date=March 14, 2011 |accessdate=March 14, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110418105954/http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/march/218230/Cast-member-injured-at-Disney-Animal-Kingdoms-Primeval-Whirl |archivedate=April 18, 2011 |df= }}</ref>
=== Festival of the Lion King === {{Main|Festival of the Lion King}} * On March 21, 2016, a small [[electrical fire]] originating from beneath one of the puppet floats broke out during a performance of ''[[Festival of the Lion King]]''. The fire was quickly extinguished and no one was hurt in the incident. The show resumed performances the next day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bradenton.com/mld/bradenton/14933003.htm |title=Breaking News, Sports, Weather & More - Bradenton.com & Bradenton Herald |publisher= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110607061107/http://www.bradenton.com/mld/bradenton/14933003.htm |archivedate=June 7, 2011 |df= }}</ref>
=== ''Avatar'' Flight of Passage === {{Main article|Avatar Flight of Passage}} * There were several instances where visitors became unconscious on the ride, leading to the installation of warning cards for riders before entering the ride. The cards are similar to those on [[Mission: Space]] and warn riders about [[acrophobia|fear of heights]], [[motion sickness]], and the seating restraints.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wdwnt.com/2018/02/photo-guests-riding-avatar-flight-passage-animal-kingdom-now-given-warning-cards/ |title=PHOTO: Guests Riding Avatar Flight of Passage at Animal Kingdom Now Given Warning Cards |publisher=WDW News Today |date=February 27, 2018 |accessdate=February 28, 2018 |df= }} </ref> ** On June 12, 2017, a 79-year-old woman passed out after becoming dizzy.<ref name="FoxNews-Avatar-Ride-PassOut">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/travel/2017/07/19/disneys-avatar-ride-causes-woman-to-pass-out-according-to-new-report-on-theme-park-injuries.html |title=Disney's Avatar Ride causes woman to pass out, according to new report of theme-park injuries |publisher=Fox News |date=July 19, 2017 |accessdate=July 19, 2017 |df= }} </ref> ** On June 24, 2017, a 31-year-old woman passed out after becoming ill.<ref name="FoxNews-Avatar-Ride-PassOut"/> ** On October 27, 2017, a 77-year-old woman fell while boarding the ride.<ref name="OrlandSentinel-Jealth-Issues">{{cite web|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-theme-park-injury-report-january-20180116-story.html |title=Disney: 2 health issues reported at Flight of Passage at Animal Kingdom, report says |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=January 16, 2017 |accessdate=January 16, 2018 |df= }}</ref> ** On November 4, 2017, a 56-year-old woman temporarily passed out on the ride.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-Jealth-Issues">{{cite web|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-theme-park-injury-report-january-20180116-story.html |title=Disney: 2 health issues reported at Flight of Passage at Animal Kingdom, report says |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=January 16, 2017 |accessdate=January 16, 2018 |df= }}</ref>
==Disney's Hollywood Studios==
===Star Tours: The Adventures Continue=== {{main|Star Tours: The Adventures Continue}} *In October 2016, a 67-year-old man from [[Tennessee]] died after riding Star Tours. The rider had a pre-existing heart condition along with other contributing factors. The incident was described as part of a quarterly report filed with the Florida Department of Agriculture, which oversees the safety of the state's amusement parks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ajc.com/news/national/report-tourist-dies-after-riding-disney-star-tours/Vbksrv7RQcCdQugsqQEtNI/ |title=Report: Tourist dies after riding Disney's Star Tours |work=ajc.com |publisher=Cox Newspapers |date=October 24, 2016 |accessdate=October 26, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161026232925/http://www.ajc.com/news/national/report-tourist-dies-after-riding-disney-star-tours/Vbksrv7RQcCdQugsqQEtNI/ |archivedate=October 26, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Pedicini |first1=Sandra |title=Visitor dies after Star Tours ride at Disney World |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-cfb-tourism-column-1024-20161020-story.html |website=OrlandoSentinel.com |accessdate=October 26, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161025225433/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-cfb-tourism-column-1024-20161020-story.html |archivedate=October 25, 2016 |df= }}</ref>
===Rock 'n' Roller Coaster=== {{Main|Rock 'n' Roller Coaster Starring Aerosmith}} * On June 29, 2006, a 12-year-old boy visiting from [[Fort Campbell, Kentucky]], was found to be unresponsive after the ride came to an end. Though his father administered CPR until paramedics arrived, he was declared dead on the way to the hospital.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20060629/ap_on_re_us/disney |title=Boy dies after Disney roller coaster ride |first=Travis |last=Reed |date=June 29, 2006 |agency=Associated Press |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060706043835/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20060629/ap_on_re_us/disney_death |archivedate=July 6, 2006}}</ref> The ride was shut down for the investigation and reopened a day later after inspectors determined that the ride was operating normally. The victim had died as a result of a [[congenital heart defect]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wesh.com/travelgetaways/10008163/detail.html |title=Disney Closes Roller coaster after Rider Falls Ill |publisher=WESH-TV |date=October 5, 2004 |accessdate=October 6, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061103071101/http://www.wesh.com/travelgetaways/10008163/detail.html |archivedate=November 3, 2006 |df= }}</ref>
===The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror=== {{Main|The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror}} * On July 12, 2005, a 16-year-old girl from [[Kibworth]], Leicestershire, United Kingdom, complained of a severe headache and other symptoms after riding the Tower of Terror. She was taken to an [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]] hospital in [[critical condition]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.local6.com/news/4713504/detail.html |title=Girl Remains Critical After Riding Disney's 'Tower Of Terror' |publisher=Local 6 |date=July 12, 2005 |accessdate=January 5, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061224001056/http://www.local6.com/news/4713504/detail.html |archivedate=December 24, 2006 |df= }}</ref> where she underwent surgery for intracranial bleeding. On August 6, 2005, she returned to the United Kingdom via [[air ambulance]]. While she had reportedly ridden the attraction several times during her visit with no ill effects,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_kmusa/is_200507/ai_n14776925 |title=Another vacationer collapses |publisher=USAToday |date=July 12, 2005 |accessdate=January 5, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080120204830/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_kmusa/is_200507/ai_n14776925 |archivedate=January 20, 2008 |df= }}</ref> she had been in pain for a few days prior to the incident. She had a massive stroke leading to cardiac arrest. After an examination by both Disney and state inspectors showed no ride malfunction, the ride was reopened the next day. The girl returned home safely after spending six months in the hospital due to two heart attacks and surgery.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.harboroughtoday.co.uk/ViewArticle2.aspx?SectionID=760&ArticleID=1298112 |title=Coma girl home for festive meal |publisher=Harborough Today |date=December 29, 2005 |accessdate=January 5, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070318052937/http://www.harboroughtoday.co.uk/ViewArticle2.aspx?SectionID=760 |archivedate=March 18, 2007 }}</ref> On February 13, 2009, the victim's family sued Disney for negligence in the ride design, failing to adequately warn riders, and not providing proper safety restraints. They were seeking at least US$15,000,000.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,491432,00.html |agency=Associated Press |date=February 12, 2009 |accessdate=May 26, 2009 |title=Woman claims Disney ride caused stroke |work=Fox News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090303165332/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0%2C2933%2C491432%2C00.html |archivedate=March 3, 2009 |df= }}</ref> The lawsuit was voluntarily dismissed in 2012 <ref>{{cite web |title=$15M Tower of Terror lawsuit against Disney dropped |url=https://www.bizjournals.com/orlando/news/2012/12/27/15m-tower-of-terror-lawsuit-against.html |website=www.bizjournals.com |accessdate=29 October 2018}}</ref>
===Indiana Jones Epic Stunt Spectacular!=== {{main|Indiana Jones Epic Stunt Spectacular!}} A number of incidents involving the show's performers have occurred since the live-action show's premiere in 1989.
