In 1990, [[Occupational Safety and Health Administration|OSHA]] fined the resort $1,000 after three performers were injured in three separate incidents.<ref name="Sentinel0817">{{cite news|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/1834837141.html?FMT=ABS |title=Third Disney employee dies in just over month |first=Willoughby |last=Mariano |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=August 17, 2009 |accessdate=August 18, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121104092943/https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/orlandosentinel/access/1834837141.html?FMT=ABS |archivedate=November 4, 2012 |df= }}</ref> * In one incident, a performer fell 30 feet (9.14 m) when a restraining cable failed. * In another, a performer fell 25 feet (7.62 m) when a prop ladder collapsed unexpectedly. * A third performer was pinned by a malfunctioning trap door.<ref name="Sentinel0817"/> At the time, OSHA cited Disney for failing to provide adequate fall protection, including padding and other equipment.<ref name="Sentinel0817"/> * Later, while rehearsing a new, safer routine, another performer fell 25 feet (7.62 m) onto concrete.<ref name="Sentinel0817"/> * In a rehearsal on August 17, 2009, a 30-year-old male performer died after injuring his head while performing a tumbling roll.<ref name="Fox0818">{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,540220,00.html?test=latestnews |title=Disney World Stuntman Dies Rehearsing for Show in Theme Park's Third Fatal Accident |agency=Associated Press |date=August 18, 2009 |accessdate=August 18, 2009 |work=Fox News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090821075821/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0%2C2933%2C540220%2C00.html?test=latestnews |archivedate=August 21, 2009 |df= }}</ref> Performances for the next day were canceled out of respect for him.<ref name="Fox0818"/>
===Toy Story Mania!=== {{main|Toy Story Mania!}} * In October 2014, a 64-year-old woman lost consciousness on the ride and died. The death was not believed to be related to the ride.<ref name=pedicini/>
==Disney Springs== {{main|Disney Springs}}
===Sea Raycer=== * On April 22, 2010, a 61-year-old woman from [[Celebration, Florida]], suffered a collapsed lung, fractured ribs, and back pain due to a boating accident near the Treehouse Villas. The rented Sea Raycer that her husband was driving collided with a Disney ferryboat. The [[Orange County Sheriff's Office (Florida)|Orange County Sheriff's]] report states that the Sea Raycer crossed into the ferry's right-of-way.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/breakingnews/os-disney-treehouse-boating-accident-20100427,0,6701697.story |first=Anika Myers |last=Palm |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |title=Woman injured in boat crash at Disney |accessdate=April 27, 2010 |date=April 27, 2010}}</ref>
===Other incidents involving guests=== * On December 25, 2015, a fight broke out at Bongo's Cuban Cafe between a 70-year-old male guest and the restaurant staff. The guest claimed that he was tired of waiting for his food. He argued with the restaurant's general manager and threw a punch but missed. Another employee jumped in to try to stop the confrontation. The guest was escorted out of the restaurant after he grabbed a worker's bicep, which left a mark. At some point during the fight, a series of loud sounds were mistaken as gunfire, causing patrons to panic and rush to the exits. This false information was also spread throughout social media, resulting in other guests in Disney Springs to panic as well. Police found no evidence of shots being fired. The man was arrested shortly thereafter in front of a Starbucks with no weapons in his possession, and was charged with battery.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Deputies: 70-year-old man's scuffle about food led to chaotic scene at Disney Springs |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-disney-springs-false-shooting-chaos-20151226-story.html |website=OrlandoSentinel.com |accessdate=December 27, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151227022046/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-disney-springs-false-shooting-chaos-20151226-story.html |archivedate=December 27, 2015 |df= }}</ref>
==Epcot==
===Body Wars=== {{Main|Body Wars}} * On May 16, 1995, a 4-year-old girl with a known heart condition passed out during a ride on the [[Body Wars]] attraction in the [[Wonders of Life]] pavilion. The ride was stopped immediately and paramedics took her to a hospital where she was pronounced dead. An autopsy was inconclusive as to whether the ride had aggravated her condition.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.snopes.com/disney/parks/bodywars.htm |title=SNOPES article on Body Wars death |publisher=Snopes.com |accessdate=May 22, 2012}}</ref>
===Mission: Space=== {{Main|Mission: Space}} * From June 2005 to June 2006, paramedics treated 194 Mission: Space riders. The most common complaints were dizziness, nausea and vomiting. Of those 194 guests: 25 people passed out, 26 suffered difficulty breathing and 16 reported chest pains or irregular heartbeats.<ref>[http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-mdisfall1106jul11,0,7480628.story?coll=orl-business-headlines-tourism Mission: Space statistics according to Reedy Creek Fire Department records]{{dead link|date=May 2012}}</ref> * On June 13, 2005, a 4-year-old boy from [[Sellersville, Pennsylvania]], died after riding Mission: Space. An autopsy by the [[Orange County, Florida|Orange County]] Medical Examiner's Office, released on November 15, 2005, found that the boy died as a result of an existing, undiagnosed [[idiopathic]] heart condition called [[myocardial]] [[organ hypertrophy|hypertrophy]]. On June 12, 2006, a lawsuit was filed against Disney by his parents, claiming that Disney should have never allowed a 4-year-old child on the ride and did not offer an adequate medical response after he collapsed.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2005/US/11/15/disney.death/ |title=Autopsy report on Mission: Space rider |publisher=CNN |date=November 15, 2005 |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121108212141/http://www.cnn.com/2005/US/11/15/disney.death/ |archivedate=November 8, 2012 |df= }}</ref> On January 11, 2007, the lawsuit was [[Prejudice (legal procedure)|dismissed with prejudice]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://officialrecords.occompt.com/recorder/eagleweb/viewDoc.jsp?node=DOCC28653068 |title=Bamuwamye vs Disney court record (Document #20070045734) |publisher=Orange County Comptroller Official Records |date=January 22, 2007 |accessdate=October 22, 2009}}</ref> * On April 12, 2006, a 49-year-old woman from [[Schmitten, Germany|Schmitten]], [[Germany]], fell ill after riding Mission: Space and died at Celebration Hospital in nearby [[Celebration, Florida]]. An autopsy determined that she died from a brain hemorrhage caused by longstanding and severe [[high blood pressure]]; there was no evidence of trauma attributable to the ride.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2006/US/04/14/disneyworld.death/index.html |title=Woman who died after Disney ride suffered stroke |publisher=CNN |date=April 14, 2006 |accessdate=October 22, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090807023355/http://edition.cnn.com/2006/US/04/14/disneyworld.death/index.html |archivedate=August 7, 2009 |df= }}</ref>
===Parking lot=== * On November 21, 1984, a husband and wife, along with their 1-year-old daughter, were killed, and two other children were injured when the single-engine plane they were flying in crashed while attempting an emergency landing in the Epcot parking lot. The [[Piper Aircraft|Piper]] aircraft was approaching an empty section of the parking lot when it clipped a light pole, shearing off the right wing, and crashed into several parked cars. The family was flying from Greer, South Carolina to Kissimmee, Florida for a vacation at Disney World.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Zollman |first1=Peter |title=A rented plane flying a South Carolina family of... |url=http://www.upi.com/Archives/1984/11/21/A-rented-plane-flying-a-South-Carolina-family-of/7965469861200/ |website=upi.com |accessdate=September 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002143736/http://www.upi.com/Archives/1984/11/21/A-rented-plane-flying-a-South-Carolina-family-of/7965469861200/ |archivedate=October 2, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Zollman|first1=Peter|title=Private Plane Crashes at Disney World, 3 Killed|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2457&dat=19841122&id=UDFfAAAAIBAJ&sjid=LU8NAAAAIBAJ&pg=1180,2457058&hl=en|website=news.google.com|publisher=Schenectady Gazette|accessdate=September 29, 2016}}</ref> * On January 14, 1986, the bodies of a 33-year-old man and a woman were discovered floating in a retention pond after they drove their car down an embankment and into the water during a heavy rainstorm several days earlier. Authorities speculate that the two attempted to escape from the vehicle through the driver's side window as it sank into the six-feet deep water. The vehicle's lights and windshield wipers were found in the "on" position, leading authorities to believe that the driver lost visibility during a rainstorm, jumped a curb and slid down an embankment into the pond.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hamburg |first1=Jay |title=Tourists Miss Epcot Bridge, Die In Pond |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1986-01-15/news/0190180015_1_walt-disney-epcot-pond |website=OrlandoSentinel.com |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |accessdate=September 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002132157/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1986-01-15/news/0190180015_1_walt-disney-epcot-pond |archivedate=October 2, 2016 |df= }}</ref>
===Spaceship Earth=== {{Main|Spaceship Earth (Epcot)}} * On August 14, 1999, a 5-year-old boy was seriously injured after exiting a ride car at Spaceship Earth. He was treated for an open compound fracture at the [[Orlando Regional Medical Center]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1999-08-14/news/9908140152_1_spaceship-earth-epcot-spaceship-austin |title=Child Hurt In Fall From Epcot Ride |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=August 14, 1999 |accessdate=September 10, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121005104958/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1999-08-14/news/9908140152_1_spaceship-earth-epcot-spaceship-austin |archivedate=October 5, 2012 |df= }}</ref>
===Other incidents involving guests=== * On September 12, 1992, a 37-year-old man entered Epcot after park closing and brandished a shotgun at three security guards, demanding to see his ex-girlfriend who worked at the park. He fired four blasts at the guards and took two of them hostage in a restroom near the [[Imagination! (Epcot pavilion)|Journey Into Imagination pavilion]]. As Orange County sheriff's deputies surrounded the area, the man released his hostages and emerged from the restroom with the shotgun held to his chest. After exchanging words with deputies, he put the gun to his head and fired. He was pronounced dead on arrival at the Orlando Regional Medical Center. Investigators attributed his actions to a recent breakup with his long-time girlfriend.<ref>{{cite news|title=Painful Split Preceded Epcot Death |first=Jim |last=Leusner |newspaper=OrlandoSentinel |date=September 14, 1992 |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1992-09-14/news/9209140122_1_ferris-shotgun-solomons |accessdate=October 27, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120908044056/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1992-09-14/news/9209140122_1_ferris-shotgun-solomons |archivedate=September 8, 2012 |df= }}</ref> * In July 2012, a 41-year-old doctor from Naples, [[Italy]], was arrested after allegedly kicking his 3-year-old son in the face. According to arrest reports, several witnesses saw him kick his son while he sat in his stroller during an argument with his wife and children. An Epcot employee then "went up to the child and saw that his face was bloody and the child was crying hysterically". The father refused to let his son be taken to a hospital because he did not think the boy's injuries required further attention. Detectives noted that the boy's left eye was swollen and bruised with a cut below it. The doctor was eventually freed on a $2,000 bond after being arrested and charged with child abuse. Once back to Italy, he gave the media his own version of the story. He said that the incident occurred on June 30, 2012. He kicked his 9-year-old son after the boy overturned the stroller in which his little brother was seated. The toddler fell on his face and was therefore bleeding. One of the tourists, seeing the little child bleeding, called the police. The whole family was taken to a room and kept there for four hours; a young Italian woman on the premises, working for Disney, served as an emergency interpreter for the two parents; the man was then arrested and left in a police car for six hours before ending up jailed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tgcom24.mediaset.it/mondo/articoli/1052006/disney-world-litaliano-arrestato-si-difende-ho-dato-solo-un-calcio-nel-sedere-a-mio-figlio.shtml |title=Disney World, l'italiano arrestato si difende: "Ho dato solo un calcio nel sedere a mio figlio" - Mondo |publisher= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150927201850/http://www.tgcom24.mediaset.it/mondo/articoli/1052006/disney-world-litaliano-arrestato-si-difende-ho-dato-solo-un-calcio-nel-sedere-a-mio-figlio.shtml |archivedate=September 27, 2015 |df= }}</ref> * In October 2013, Austin DeVan Hill, a 23-year-old male and 2012 graduate of the [[U.S. Naval Academy]] was charged with aggravated battery and two counts of battery after he assaulted three cast members during the [[Epcot International Food and Wine Festival]]. The man, who was intoxicated at the time of the incident, assaulted a female employee with a PVC pipe, and punched two male employees in the head. One male cast member received a large gash to his head and the other suffered minor injuries. The female was struck with the pipe on her left cheek and neck and was left with swelling behind her ears. The men were treated at nearby Celebration Hospital, while the female employee was treated on the scene. The man had entered the backstage office area in the Innoventions East attraction and tried to commandeer a cargo work cart when the confrontation began. Security officers arrived and tried to subdue him. He continued to shout incoherent statements and then fled the officers. They were able to eventually force him to the ground. When police arrived, the man was bleeding from his knees, wrists and hands. He later paid his bond at Orange County Jail.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.miaminewtimes.com/riptide/2013/10/drunk_florida_man_attacks_thre.php |title=Drunk Florida Man Attacks Three Disney World Cast Members |publisher=Miami New Times |accessdate=October 14, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131014210227/http://blogs.miaminewtimes.com/riptide/2013/10/drunk_florida_man_attacks_thre.php |archivedate=October 14, 2013 |df= }}</ref> * On October 1, 2017, [[Giles Barnes]], [[Alex Morgan]], Courtney Toia, and [[Donny Toia|Donald Toia]] were all ejected from the park after Morgan and her group were partying inside a pub in the UK pavilion. An altercation ensued, and the OCSO reported that Barnes cut in front of another guest, resulting in a verbal argument between them. His use of [[profanity]] resulted in his ejection; as deputies and security guards were accompanying Barnes out, they saw Morgan and some of her group get "belligerent & very loud" towards staff at the front of the Spaceship Earth attraction. A short time later, deputies were alerted to Donald Toia, who got aggressive inside the aforementioned pub; his wife Courtney became "verbally aggressive towards the pub manager" and used profanity in front of guests. All three were ejected for their actions.<ref>{{cite news|last1=DelGallo|first1=Alicia|title=Alex Morgan among group of Orlando City SC players kicked out of Disney World|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/sports/orlando-pride-soccer/os-sp-orlando-city-alex-morgan-disney-20171003-story.html|work=Orlando Sentinel}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Alex Morgan and Orlando City players removed from Epcot Center by police|url=http://www.espnfc.com/orlando-city-sc/story/3220005/alex-morgan-and-orlando-city-players-removed-from-epcot-center-by-police|website=ESPNFC.com}}</ref> * On November 5, 2017, a runner in the [[runDisney|Disney Wine & Dine Half Marathon]] collapsed and died near the finish line in the Epcot parking lot. No other details were initially disclosed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ruiter|first1=Jason|title=Disney Wine & Dine Half Marathon runner collapses and dies, Disney says|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-walt-disney-world-half-marathon-runner-died-20171105-story.html|work=Orlando Sentinel|date=November 5, 2017}}</ref>
==Magic Kingdom== {{Main|Magic Kingdom}}
===Astro Orbiter=== {{Main|Astro Orbiter}} * On October 9, 2011, a fire broke out in the centerpiece of the attraction structure. Authorities reported that the fire was caused by a light bulb that shorted out and started to smolder. The incident occurred shortly after the park had opened for the day, and no guests were aboard the ride when the fire was discovered.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/the-daily-disney/os-astro-orbiter-fire-at-walt-disney-world-101011-20111009,0,4993726.story |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120907024740/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/the-daily-disney/os-astro-orbiter-fire-at-walt-disney-world-101011-20111009,0,4993726.story |dead-url=yes |archive-date=September 7, 2012 |title=Fire closes ride at Walt Disney World's Magic Kingdom |first=Leslie |last=Postal |newspaper=Orlando Sentinel |publisher=Tribune Newspapers |date=October 9, 2011 |accessdate=October 20, 2011 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The attraction re-opened the following day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/october/326574/Astro-Orbiter-reopens-at-Magic-Kingdom-after-fire |title=Astro Orbiter reopens at Magic Kingdom after fire |work=CFNews13.com |date=October 10, 2011 |accessdate=October 20, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111019203126/http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/october/326574/Astro-Orbiter-reopens-at-Magic-Kingdom-after-fire |archivedate=October 19, 2011 }}</ref>
===Backstage=== * On February 11, 2004, a 38-year-old employee named Javier Cruz dressed as [[Pluto (Disney)|Pluto]], who had worked at the park for eight years, died at the Magic Kingdom when he was run over by the ''Beauty and the Beast'' float in the ''Share a Dream Come True Parade.'' Disney representatives commented that no incident of these circumstances had ever happened before to a cast member and that no guests had seen the incident.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2004-02-12/news/0402120326_1_javier-cruz-float-disney-character |title=Disney Worker Killed in Parade Accident |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=February 12, 2004 |accessdate=October 6, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151007075300/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2004-02-12/news/0402120326_1_javier-cruz-float-disney-character |archivedate=October 7, 2015 |df= }}</ref> This led OSHA to fine Disney US$6,300 for having employees in restricted areas.<ref name="OSHA2005"/>
===Big Thunder Mountain Railroad=== {{Main|Big Thunder Mountain Railroad}} *In the October 2016 issue of ''[[The Journal of the American Osteopathic Association|Journal of the American Osteopathic Association]]'', Doctor David Wartinger found that some of his patients had passed kidney stones after riding Big Thunder Mountain Railroad, including one who passed three stones on three separate occasions. With Disney's permission, Wartinger then tested these results with a 3D model of a kidney by riding the coaster over 20 times. The study found nearly 70% of the time, the kidney stone was passed, with results varying depending on which row they were in.<ref name="Validation of a Functional Pyelocalyceal">{{cite journal|last1=Mitchell|first1=Marc A.|last2=Wartinger|first2=David D.|title=Validation of a Functional Pyelocalyceal Renal Model for the Evaluation of Renal Calculi Passage While Riding a Roller Coaster|journal=The Journal of the American Osteopathic Association|date=October 1, 2016|volume=116|issue=10|pages=647|doi=10.7556/jaoa.2016.128|pmid=27669068|url=http://jaoa.org/article.aspx?articleid=2557373|issn=0098-6151}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Willingham|first1=AJ|title=Little kidney stone? Ride a roller coaster, says study|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/09/28/health/kidney-stone-roller-coaster-study-trnd/|website=CNN|accessdate=September 29, 2016}}</ref> The study also found that the [[Space Mountain (Magic Kingdom)|Space Mountain]] and [[Rock 'n' Roller Coaster Starring Aerosmith]] failed to cause this result.<ref>{{cite web|title=Got kidney stones? Ride a roller coaster|author=Michigan State University|url=http://msutoday.msu.edu/news/2016/got-kidney-stones-ride-a-roller-coaster/|website=MSUToday|publisher=Michigan State University|accessdate=September 29, 2016}}</ref> *In February 2017, a 54-year-old man died after riding the attraction. His cause of death is believed to be natural causes as he had a pre-existing medical condition. Sheri Blanton, from the Orange County Medical Examiner's Office, said in an email that "death did not appear to be one of its cases, so the man likely had an attending physician who agreed to sign out the death certificate due to natural causes". She eventually said "If he had been under a doctor's care and there was no trauma indicated, the medical examiner's office would be notified". A Disney spokesperson said the ride was operating as normal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/os-cfb-tourism-disney-death-20170421-story.html |title=Man dies after riding Disney World's Big Thunder Mountain Railroad |newspaper=Orlando Sentinel |date=April 21, 2017 |accessdate=April 21, 2017 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://kron4.com/2017/04/22/man-dies-after-riding-thunder-mountain-in-disney-world/ |title=Man dies after riding Thunder Mountain in Disney World |publisher=KRON4 |date=April 22, 2017 |accessdate=April 22, 2017 |df= }}</ref>
===It's a Small World=== {{main|It's a Small World}} * On August 18, 1994, a 6-year-old girl from [[Miami, Florida]], fell out of one of the ride's boats while it was in the loading area. Orange County authorities believe an incoming boat then struck her after the fall. The girl suffered a broken hip, a broken arm and a collapsed lung, Paramedics took her to a hospital and she was able to recover fully from her injuries successfully. The ride was closed for an inspection and re-opened the following day.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1994-08-30/features/9408300128_1_barbara-paribanez-ride-small-world |title=Girl Tumbles From Disney's "It's a Small World" Ride, Is Hurt |newspaper=Chicago Tribune |date=August 30, 1994 |accessdate=August 4, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121001224726/http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1994-08-30/features/9408300128_1_barbara-paribanez-ride-small-world |archivedate=October 1, 2012 |df= }}</ref> * On December 25, 2014, a 22-year-old woman lost consciousness after riding the attraction. She later died. The woman had a pre-existing condition.<ref name=pedicini>{{cite news|first=Sandra |last=Pedicini |title=Disney reports deaths after Small World, Toy Story rides |quote= |newspaper=[[Orlando Sentinel]] |date=January 21, 2015 |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/os-disney-deaths-rides-20150121-story.html |accessdate=June 13, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150626193100/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/os-disney-deaths-rides-20150121-story.html |archivedate=June 26, 2015 |df= }}</ref>
===Main Street, U.S.A.=== {{main|Main Street U.S.A.}} * On August 11, 1977, a 4-year-old boy from [[Dolton, Illinois]], drowned in the moat surrounding Cinderella Castle. The family sued Disney for US$4 million and won; however, the jury found the plaintiffs 50% liable for allowing the boy to climb over a fence while playing and reduced the settlement amount to US$2 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=uisaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=pg4EAAAAIBAJ&dq=joel-goode%20disney&pg=2392%2C5764519 |publisher=Ocala Star Banner |date=March 10, 1985 |accessdate=June 30, 2009 |title=Compensation needed in Disney case: Juror}}</ref>
===Pirates of the Caribbean=== {{Main|Pirates of the Caribbean (attraction)}} * In February 2005, a 77-year-old woman from Minnesota lost consciousness and died after riding the Pirates of the Caribbean. A medical examiner's report said the victim was in poor health and she had several ministrokes. The report concluded that her death "was not unexpected."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.local6.com/news/4713504/detail.html |title=Article mentioning PotC incident |publisher=Local6.com |date=May 14, 2012 |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080708201812/http://www.local6.com/news/4713504/detail.html |archivedate=July 8, 2008 |df= }}</ref> * On August 6, 2009, a 47-year-old employee playing the role of a pirate in the "Captain Jack's Pirate Tutorial" show slipped on a puddle on the stage and hit his head on a wall. He was taken to Florida Hospital Orlando with injuries including a broken vertebra in his neck and severe lacerations on his head that required 55 stitches. He died on August 10 due to complications.<ref>{{cite news|title=Disney performer dies after falling during pirate show |first1=Willoughby |last1=Mariano |first2=Jason |last2=Garcia |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2009-08-11/news/disney_1_priest-breslauer-captain-jack |newspaper=Orlando Sentinel |date=August 11, 2009 |accessdate=September 24, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115024644/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2009-08-11/news/disney_1_priest-breslauer-captain-jack |archivedate=January 15, 2013 |df= }}</ref> * On July 10, 2014, a 12-year-old boy from the United Kingdom was hospitalized after losing the tips of his ring and pinky fingers on his right hand while riding the Pirates of the Caribbean. The guest had his hand outside of the ride vehicle at the time of the incident. The ride was shut down briefly for inspection and later reopened after it was deemed safe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/558920/disney-world-guest-suffers-accident-on-pirates-of-the-caribbean-ride-loses-tips-of-2-fingers |title=Disney World Guest Suffers Accident on Pirates of the Caribbean Ride, Loses Tips of 2 Fingers |publisher=E! News |date=July 11, 2014 |accessdate=July 11, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140713214531/http://www.eonline.com/news/558920/disney-world-guest-suffers-accident-on-pirates-of-the-caribbean-ride-loses-tips-of-2-fingers |archivedate=July 13, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===Prince Charming Regal Carrousel=== {{Main|Prince Charming Regal Carrousel}} * On December 12, 2010, a 77-year-old woman with pre-existing conditions collapsed after exiting. She later died due to the incident.<ref>{{cite news|title=Disney reports death on Prince Charming carousel ride |work=ABC Action News |date=February 7, 2011 |url=http://www.abcactionnews.com/dpp/news/state/disney-reports-death-on-prince-charming-carousel-ride |accessdate=February 25, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201204644/http://www.abcactionnews.com/dpp/news/state/disney-reports-death-on-prince-charming-carousel-ride |archivedate=February 1, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===Skyway=== {{Main|Skyway (Disney)}} * On May 23, 1982, a 20-year-old worker was standing near the ledge of the Fantasyland station when the Skyway started up; she grabbed onto a seat and traveled {{convert|100|ft}} before a staff member stopped the ride. Some visitors climbed onto the roof of a nearby building, but could not reach her. She fell {{convert|15|ft|0}} to the roof, slid off, and dropped another {{convert|20|ft|0}} to the ground; she injured her back but survived.<ref>[[#Koenig07|Koenig 2007]]: 146</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1665&dat=19820525&id=I2AaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=zSQEAAAAIBAJ&pg=1905,2852041&hl=en|title=Disney World Employee Injured|publisher=The Times-News|date=May 25, 1982|accessdate=June 25, 2016}}</ref> * On February 14, 1999, a 65-year-old part-time custodian was killed when he fell off a seat. He was cleaning the Fantasyland Skyway station platform when the ride was accidentally turned on by staff not knowing he was there. He was in the path of the ride vehicles and grabbed a passing seat in an attempt to save himself. He lost his grip, fell {{convert|40|ft}}, and landed in a flower bed near the [[Dumbo the Flying Elephant|Dumbo]] ride. He was dead on arrival at a local hospital. The Skyway ride, which had been scheduled to be closed before the accident occurred, was permanently closed on November 10, 1999.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9D06E5DB103AF935A25751C0A96F958260 |title=National News Briefs; Cable Car Accident Kills Disney World Worker |work=New York Times |date=February 16, 1999 |accessdate=January 17, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080120233733/http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9D06E5DB103AF935A25751C0A96F958260 |archivedate=January 20, 2008 |df= }}</ref> As a result of the accident, OSHA fined Walt Disney World US$4,500 for violating federal safety codes in that work area.<ref name=snopesskyway>Mikkelson, David P. (August 23, 2007) [http://www.snopes.com/disney/parks/skyway.asp "Skyway to Heaven"]. [[snopes.com]]. Retrieved February 2, 2012.</ref> The incident echoed a [[Incidents at Disneyland Resort#Skyway|similar incident]] at [[Disneyland Resort]] in 1994, when a 30-year-old man fell 20 feet (6 m) out of a Skyway cabin and subsequently tried to sue Disney. In that case, however, the man later admitted that he had in fact jumped out of the ride, and the case was dismissed.<ref name=snopesskyway/>
===Space Mountain=== {{Main|Space Mountain (Magic Kingdom)}} * On August 12, 1980, a 10-year-old girl from [[Caracas, Venezuela]] became ill while riding Space Mountain.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=888&dat=19800816&id=tekLAAAAIBAJ&sjid=OFoDAAAAIBAJ&pg=5058,102655&hl=en|title=Death at Disney World still a puzzle|work=St. Petersburg Times|date=Aug 16, 1980|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1346&dat=19840623&id=pO8vAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ovsDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4601,2587131&hl=en|title=Inadequate care led to death at Disney World, doctors say|work=Lakeland Ledger|date=Jun 23, 1984|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}</ref> She later died of a pre-existing heart condition from a lack of oxygen.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/125329801/ |title=Disney death natural |work=Florida Today |date=Aug 19, 1980 |accessdate=June 24, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160815104703/https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/125329801/ |archivedate=August 15, 2016 |df= }}</ref> * In 1998, a 37-year-old man was hit on the head by a falling object. His left arm was paralyzed, and he suffered from short-term memory loss (losing his job in the process). Two objects were discovered at the bottom floor of Space Mountain: a camera and a candle from Frontierland.<ref>[[#Koenig07|Koenig 2007]]: 139</ref> * On August 1, 2006, a 6-year-old boy fainted after riding Space Mountain and was taken to Celebration Hospital where he died. The victim was a [[terminal cancer]] patient visiting the Magic Kingdom as a part of the [[Give Kids the World]] program. The medical examiner's report showed that he died of [[natural causes]] due to a metastatic pulmonary [[blastoma]] tumor.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/orange/orl-themepark1806oct18,0,5055753.story?coll=orl-news-headlines-orange |title=Safety report: Boy died after ride at Disney |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=October 18, 2006 |accessdate=October 24, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080120161914/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/orange/orl-themepark1806oct18%2C0%2C5055753.story?coll=orl-news-headlines-orange |archivedate=January 20, 2008 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> * On December 7, 2006, a 73-year-old man lost consciousness while riding Space Mountain. He was transported to a hospital and died three days later. The medical examiner found that the man died of natural causes due to a heart condition.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/business_tourism_aviation/2007/01/quarterly_state.html |title=Orlando Sentinel – Quarterly state reports cite "natural" death, injuries – Jan 30, 2007 |publisher=Blogs.orlandosentinel.com |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120313082538/http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/business_tourism_aviation/2007/01/quarterly_state.html |archivedate=March 13, 2012 |df= }}</ref> * On July 7, 2015, a 55-year-old woman from [[Kingsport, Tennessee]] died of cardiopulmonary arrest and [[septic shock]] after losing consciousness while on the ride. According to the medical examiner, her medical history showed a history of [[hypertension]] and congestive heart failure.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/os-woman-died-space-mountain-20151023-post.html |date=October 23, 2015 |accessdate=October 24, 2015 |title=Woman died after riding Space Mountain at Disney World, state report shows |first=Sandra |last=Pedicini |work=Orlando Sentinel |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151024161643/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/os-woman-died-space-mountain-20151023-post.html |archivedate=October 24, 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://patch.com/florida/brandon/woman-dies-after-riding-disneys-space-mountain-0 |date=October 26, 2015 |accessdate=May 30, 2016 |title=Woman Dies After Riding Disney's Space Mountain |first1=Sherri |last1=Lonon |publisher=Brandon Patch |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609184417/http://patch.com/florida/brandon/woman-dies-after-riding-disneys-space-mountain-0 |archivedate=June 9, 2016 |df= }}</ref>
===Seven Dwarfs Mine Train=== {{Main|Seven Dwarfs Mine Train}} * On November 1, 2014, falling embers from the ''[[Wishes: A Magical Gathering of Disney Dreams|Wishes]]'' fireworks show landed on the artificial grass exterior of the ride, causing a fire near the bridge that the coaster travels on just before entering the mine. This caused the ride and the area around it to be evacuated.<ref>{{cite web|title=There was a small fire tonight at Seven Dwarfs Mine Train... |url=https://twitter.com/Attractions/status/528751035993845760 |website=twitter.com |publisher=@attractions (Attractions Magazine) |accessdate=November 2, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151103143636/https://twitter.com/Attractions/status/528751035993845760 |archivedate=November 3, 2015 |df= }}</ref> There were no injuries reported and the ride reopened later that evening.<ref>{{cite news|title=Seven Dwarfs Mine Train catches fire at Walt Disney World, no injuries reported |url=http://myfox8.com/2014/11/01/seven-dwarfs-mine-train-on-fire-at-disney-world/ |accessdate=November 2, 2014 |work=WGHP FOX 8 |date=November 1, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141102035939/http://myfox8.com/2014/11/01/seven-dwarfs-mine-train-on-fire-at-disney-world/ |archivedate=November 2, 2014 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Harris |first1=David |title=Fire at Seven Dwarfs train at Disney, officials say |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-dwarfs-mine-train-fire-20141101-story.html |accessdate=November 2, 2014 |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=November 1, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141105035906/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-dwarfs-mine-train-fire-20141101-story.html |archivedate=November 5, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===Splash Mountain=== {{Main|Splash Mountain}} * On November 5, 2000, a 37-year-old man from [[St. Petersburg, Florida]], was critically injured while trying to exit the ride vehicle while it was moving. He told fellow passengers that he felt ill and attempted to reach one of the attraction's marked emergency exits.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sptimes.com/2005/06/19/State/Are_parks_putting_too.shtml |title=Are parks putting too much risk in thrill rides? |publisher=St Petersburg Times |date=June 19, 2005 |accessdate=December 29, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061231084856/http://www.sptimes.com/2005/06/19/State/Are_parks_putting_too.shtml |archivedate=December 31, 2006 |df= }}</ref> He was struck by the following ride vehicle and died at a local hospital.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://html.wesh.com/orl/news/themeparknews/stories/themeparknews-20001105-165355.html |title=Man Dies On Disney's Splash Mountain |publisher=WESH News |date=November 6, 2000 |accessdate=December 29, 2006}}</ref>
===The Haunted Mansion=== {{main|The Haunted Mansion}} * On October 19, 1991, a 15-year-old girl from [[Sarasota, Florida]], was critically injured after she fell onto the tracks of the ride. According to witnesses, she was jumping from car to car and fell onto the track, where she was dragged under a moving car for at least 50 feet (15.24 m) before the ride stopped. She was airlifted to Orlando Regional Medical Center where she underwent emergency surgery for head and facial injuries.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1901&dat=19911020&id=p4MgAAAAIBAJ&sjid=Q9MEAAAAIBAJ&pg=3189,2286804&hl=en|title=Teen injured on Disney World ride|publisher=The News Journal|date=Oct 20, 1991|accessdate=June 25, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sarasota Teen Critically Injured In Fall From Ride At Disney |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1991-10-20/news/9110200613_1_haunted-mansion-kelly-ride |website=www.orlandosentinel.com |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |accessdate=September 29, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002131635/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1991-10-20/news/9110200613_1_haunted-mansion-kelly-ride |archivedate=October 2, 2016 |df= }}</ref> * In February 2007, an 89-year-old woman fell and broke her hip while exiting a ride vehicle.<ref name="1Q2007Stat"/>
===Cosmic Ray's Starlight Cafe=== * In March 2010, a 4-year-old boy from [[San Diego, California]], suffered severe burns to his face and neck after being scalded by a tray of hot nacho cheese. The accident occurred when the boy sat down to dinner in an unstable chair and grabbed a food tray to prevent himself falling, resulting in the cheese falling off of the food tray and into his lap. The parents of the child sued Disney, with their attorney claiming that "the cheese should not have been that hot" and that Disney made no effort "to regulate and monitor the temperature of the nacho cheese which was being served to young children." A Disney representative commented on the incident: "It's unfortunate when any child is injured. We just received notice of the lawsuit and are currently reviewing it."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://consumerist.com/2011/02/family-sues-disney-says-too-hot-nacho-cheese-burned-son.html |title=Family Sues Disney, Says Too-Hot Nacho Cheese Burned Son |publisher=The Consumerist |date=February 17, 2010 |accessdate=February 17, 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110220055022/http://consumerist.com/2011/02/family-sues-disney-says-too-hot-nacho-cheese-burned-son.html |archivedate=February 20, 2011 |df= }}</ref> The family settled out of court in 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://orlando.legalexaminer.com/uncategorized/miscellaneous/family-of-boy-injured-at-disneys-magic-kingdom-accepts-settlement/ |website=The Legal Examiner|title=Family of Boy Injured at Disney’s Magic Kingdom Accepts Settlement |accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref>
===Other incidents involving guests=== * On April 6, 1982, a 2-year-old girl from [[Sunrise, Florida]], died after being injured outside a park restaurant. She was standing in line with her family outside the Coral Isle Coffee Shop when she and her 12-year-old sister were playing with a rope tied to a large menu board. The girls pulled on the rope and the board fell on top of the toddler, killing her. She was pronounced dead on arrival at Orange Vista Hospital.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1873&dat=19820407&id=PaktAAAAIBAJ&sjid=x58FAAAAIBAJ&pg=3796,3527120&hl=en|title=Toddler Dies At Disney World|publisher=Daytona Beach Morning Journal|date=Apr 7, 1982|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}</ref> * On May 20, 2007, five guests from [[Shirley, New York]], ages 14 to 20 years old, were arrested for allegedly attacking a sheriff's deputy. They were accused of spitting on and harassing other guests and were detained by Disney security near Space Mountain. They were charged with resisting arrest with physical violence and battery on a uniformed law enforcement officer. An Orange County Deputy officer stated that the suspects punched him in the face.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=nation_world&id=5208729 |title=Fight Reported at Disney |publisher=ABC 6 |date=May 22, 2007 |accessdate=May 31, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130124034301/http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=nation_world&id=5208729 |archivedate=January 24, 2013 }}</ref> * On May 29, 2007, a 34-year-old woman from [[Clermont, Florida]], was attacked by a 51-year-old park guest from [[Anniston, Alabama]], as they waited in line at the Mad Tea Party attraction. Disney security interviewed witnesses on the day of the attack but Orange County police did not take any sworn statements. The victim stated that the sworn statements were not taken due to a delay in the arrival of the deputies.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cfnews13.com/News/Local/2007/5/29/woman_says_disney_delay_may_prevent_charged_in_alleged_attack.html |title=Woman Says Disney Bungled Case Of Tempest In Tea Cups |publisher=Central Florida News 13 |date=May 30, 2007 |accessdate=May 31, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070601161124/http://www.cfnews13.com/News/Local/2007/5/29/woman_says_disney_delay_may_prevent_charged_in_alleged_attack.html |archivedate=June 1, 2007 }}</ref> On July 17, 2007, an arrest warrant was issued for the attacker.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.local6.com/news/13701541/detail.html |title=Woman Accused Of Choking, Beating Disney Rider Over Place In Line |publisher=Local 6 |date=July 17, 2007 |accessdate=July 18, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070821103856/http://www.local6.com/news/13701541/detail.html |archivedate=August 21, 2007 |df= }}</ref> The victim claims that due to the incident, she has been diagnosed with a concussion and a herniated disc in her cervical spine and suffers from post-traumatic seizures.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/orl-teacups1907jul19,0,7066062.story?coll=orl_tab01_layout |title=Disney teacup tussle leads to mom's arrest |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=July 18, 2007 |accessdate=July 19, 2007}}{{dead link|date=July 2017}}</ref> The case went to trial on April 14, 2008, and the attacker was convicted on charges of battery<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nbc13.com/gulfcoastwest/vtm/news.apx.-content-articles-VTM-2008-04-14-0010.html |title=Anniston Woman Convicted Of Battery For Disney World Beating |publisher=NBC13 |date=April 14, 2008 |accessdate=April 22, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081206154801/http://www.nbc13.com/gulfcoastwest/vtm/news.apx.-content-articles-VTM-2008-04-14-0010.html |archivedate=December 6, 2008 |df= }}</ref> and sentenced to 90 days in jail and nine months probation and will have to take an anger management course.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/local/florida/sfl-0423teacupbeating,0,2528731.story |title=Woman sentenced to 90 days with credit in Disney teacup ride beating |publisher=Sun-Sentinel |date=April 23, 2008 |accessdate=April 26, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080424234525/http://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/local/florida/sfl-0423teacupbeating%2C0%2C2528731.story |archivedate=April 24, 2008 |df= }}</ref> After the trial, the victim's lawyer stated that his client intended to sue Disney to force them to address their security issues.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2011-11-03/news/os-disney-fight-lawsuit-20111103_1_mad-tea-party-theme-park-aimee-krause |title=Tea Cup Beating Victim To Sue Disney |publisher=WBDO NewsRadio 580 |date=April 23, 2008 |accessdate=February 7, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150208032851/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2011-11-03/news/os-disney-fight-lawsuit-20111103_1_mad-tea-party-theme-park-aimee-krause |archivedate=February 8, 2015 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://580wdbo.com/mp3/news/00856_Tea-Cup-Victim-to-Sue-Disney-W1---Zack.mp3 |first=Zack |last=Stein |title=Audio clip of lawyer's statement from WBDO news report on Tea Cup trial |publisher=WBDO NewsRadio 580 |date=April 23, 2008 |accessdate=April 26, 2008 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On May 9, 2008, the victim and her husband filed two separate lawsuits against Disney. Her lawsuit claims, among other things, that: Walt Disney World provided inadequate staff and security at the ride; there was a lack of adequate training to recognize security threats, that the park did not anticipate the attack and have the attacker removed before anything happened and that the following investigation was mishandled. His lawsuit against Disney is claiming the loss of his wife's support and companionship due to the attack.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/orange/orl-teacup0908may09,0,4020890.story |title='Teacups' beating victim sues Disney |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=May 9, 2008 |accessdate=May 10, 2008 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080510191255/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/orange/orl-teacup0908may09%2C0%2C4020890.story |archivedate=May 10, 2008 |df= }}</ref> In 2011 a jury found in favor of Disney.<ref>{{cite web |title=Jury doesn't award money to woman who sued Disney over attack at park |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2011-11-03/news/os-disney-fight-lawsuit-20111103_1_mad-tea-party-theme-park-aimee-krause |website=orlandosentinel.com |accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> * On April 5, 2017, a 41-year-old woman from [[New Baltimore, Michigan]], was arrested after allegedly attacking a female high school student. The woman believed the student was blocking her view of the evening fireworks show. According to the Orange County Sheriff's Office, the student and her friends stood up as the show began, blocking the view of the Michigan woman, who remained seated. The woman asked the group to sit down, but they decided to leave instead and offered the woman's family their spot. The student told authorities that as they were leaving, the woman then attacked her, grabbing her around the throat. The student started screaming for help, after which the woman released her and verbally threatened her. The student was uninjured, but decided to press charges after consulting with her parents. The woman was arrested and released on $2,000 bond.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-disney-magic-kingdom-fireworks-fight-20170406-story.html |title=Woman accused of choking girl for blocking view at Disney fireworks show |first=Rene |last=Stutzman |work=orlandosentinel.com |publisher=Tribune Newspapers |date=April 6, 2017 |accessdate=April 7, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170522044311/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-disney-magic-kingdom-fireworks-fight-20170406-story.html |archivedate=May 22, 2017 |df= }}</ref>
===Parades=== * On May 11, 2018, the [[Maleficent]] Dragon float's head in the Festival of Fantasy Parade malfunctioned and caught fire on Liberty Square, completely destroying the dragon's head.<ref name="parade-fire">{{cite web|last1=Valdes|first1=Monique|title=WATCH: Dragon float catches fire during parade at Disney's Magic Kingdom|url=https://www.wftv.com/news/local/watch-dragon-float-catches-fire-during-parade-at-disneys-magic-kingdom-/747870922|website=[[WFTV]]|accessdate=2018-05-12|date=2018-05-11|df=mdy-all}}</ref> No injuries were reported.<ref name="parade-fire"/>
==Disney's Typhoon Lagoon== {{Main|Disney's Typhoon Lagoon}}
===Mayday Falls=== * In May 2018, an 87-year-old man fractured his ankle while going down Mayday Falls.<ref name="june2018report"/>
===Wave pool=== * On August 4, 2005, a 12-year-old girl from [[Newport News, Virginia]], felt ill while using the wave pool. Lifeguards talked with her after noticing her sitting on the side of the pool; she said she felt fine, but passed out shortly thereafter. Though lifeguards performed CPR on her until paramedics arrived, she was [[dead on arrival|pronounced dead shortly after arrival at the local hospital]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.local6.com/news/4812783/detail.html |title=12-Year-Old Dies After Collapsing At Disney Park |publisher=Local6 |date=November 15, 2005 |accessdate=July 17, 2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061116075533/http://www.local6.com/news/4812783/detail.html |archivedate=November 16, 2006 |df= }}</ref> The autopsy showed that she died due to [[Heart arrhythmia|arrhythmia]] caused by an early-stage viral heart infection.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2005/11/15/national/main1045834.shtml |title=Heart Issues Caused Disney Deaths |agency=Associated Press |date=November 15, 2005 |accessdate=July 17, 2006 |work=CBS News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060706154208/http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2005/11/15/national/main1045834.shtml |archivedate=July 6, 2006 |df= }}</ref>
===Other incidents involving guests=== * On July 3, 2009, a 51-year-old man from [[Farmington, New York]], was charged with lewd and lascivious molestation after allegedly attempting to remove [[bikini|swimsuits]] from five teenage girls while all were in the wave pool. Disney security was notified and they called for Orange County deputies.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mpnnow.com/news/x737362734/Disney-groping-suspect-is-youth-minister |title=Disney Groping Suspect is Youth Minister |publisher=Daily Messenger (MPNNow.com) |first=Jessica |last=Pierce |date=July 9, 2009 |accessdate=July 13, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090712012554/http://www.mpnnow.com/news/x737362734/Disney-groping-suspect-is-youth-minister |archivedate=July 12, 2009 |df= }}</ref> * On July 10, 2009, a 51-year-old [[Connecticut]] man was charged with lewd and lascivious exhibition after he allegedly fondled himself in front of a teenage girl near the park's wave pool. One eyewitness, a visitor who worked with paroled sex-offenders in [[Missouri]], confronted the man who then fled the scene. As he attempted to leave the parking lot, he ran into a stop sign and was stopped by an Orange County deputy and detained on charges of driving with a suspended license. The man denied the lewd conduct charges, claiming his European-style swimsuit was too small. This was the fifth sexual-related reported incident to occur at a Central Florida water park in 2009; the other parks aside from Typhoon Lagoon were [[Blizzard Beach]], [[Aquatica Florida|Aquatica]], and [[Wet 'n Wild Orlando|Wet 'n Wild]].<ref name="waterparkfl09">{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/orl-bk-disney-typhoon-lagoon-suspect-071309,0,3209148.story |title=Man blames tight swimsuit for exposing himself at Typhoon Lagoon |first=Walter |last=Pacheco |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=July 13, 2009 |accessdate=July 13, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090715214152/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/orl-bk-disney-typhoon-lagoon-suspect-071309%2C0%2C3209148.story |archivedate=July 15, 2009 |df= }}</ref> The charges were dropped in August 2009 after prosecutors determined there was insufficient evidence in the case.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/orl-bk-typhoon-lagoon-incident-orlando-081909,0,2293952.story |title=Typhoon Lagoon: Charges dropped against alleged flasher at Typhoon Lagoon |first=Walter |last=Pacheco |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=August 19, 2009 |accessdate=August 19, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090822183515/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/orl-bk-typhoon-lagoon-incident-orlando-081909%2C0%2C2293952.story |archivedate=August 22, 2009 |df= }}</ref> * On July 16, 2009, a 29-year-old man from [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] was arrested and charged with one count of lewd and lascivious molestation of a 13-year-old boy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/2009/07/17/Man-accused-of-molesting-boy-at-water-park/UPI-27731247860145/ |title=Man arrested at Disney water park on lewd molestation charge |publisher=UPI |accessdate=February 12, 2011 |date=July 17, 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629144248/http://www.upi.com/Top_News/2009/07/17/Man-accused-of-molesting-boy-at-water-park/UPI-27731247860145/ |archivedate=June 29, 2011 |df= }}</ref> He was sentenced to two years in prison.<ref>{{cite news|title=Washington man gets 2 year sentence for molestation at Typhoon Lagoon |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2011-10-28/news/os-sex-attack-disney-typhoon-lagoon-20111028_1_wave-pool-molestation-washington-man |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=October 28, 2011 |accessdate=October 30, 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111130021157/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2011-10-28/news/os-sex-attack-disney-typhoon-lagoon-20111028_1_wave-pool-molestation-washington-man |archivedate=November 30, 2011 |df= }}</ref> * On July 3, 2016, a 27-year-old [[India]]n national was arrested and charged with four counts of lewd and lascivious molestation on a child over 12 years old but under the age of 16, and two counts of battery on accusations of groping six people in the wave pool.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.wdwinfo.com/news-stories/man-arrested-for-groping-six-people-at-disneys-typhoon-lagoon-water-park/ |title=Man arrested for groping six people at Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon water park |last=Zanolla |first=Leah |date= |website= |publisher= |access-date=July 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160709013213/http://www.wdwinfo.com/news-stories/man-arrested-for-groping-six-people-at-disneys-typhoon-lagoon-water-park |archivedate=July 9, 2016 |df= }}</ref> The man was released on bond a few days later.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.wesh.com/news/man-accused-of-groping-teens-at-typhoon-lagoon/40375766 |title=Man accused of groping teens at Disney's Typhoon Lagoon |last= |first= |date= |website= |publisher=WESH 2 News |access-date=July 6, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160707155109/http://www.wesh.com/news/man-accused-of-groping-teens-at-typhoon-lagoon/40375766 |archivedate=July 7, 2016 |df= }}</ref>
==Characters== * In 2005, Walt Disney World reported 773 injuries to [[Occupational Safety and Health Administration|OSHA]] for employees portraying one of 270 different characters at the parks.<ref name="OSHA2005">{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-disney0407mar04,0,4407309.story?coll=orl-business-headlines-tourism |title=A closer look behind the magic |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=March 4, 2007 |accessdate=March 4, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070321005056/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/custom/tourism/orl-disney0407mar04%2C0%2C4407309.story?coll=orl-business-headlines-tourism |archivedate=March 21, 2007 |df= }}</ref> :*Of those injuries listed, 282 (roughly 36%) were related to costuming issues, such as costume weight affecting the head, neck, or shoulders. :**49 injuries (6%) were specifically due to the costume head. :*107 injuries (14%) were caused by park guests' interactions with the characters, where the guest hit, pushed, or otherwise hurt (intentionally or not) the costumed employee. :*Other items in the report include skin rashes, bruises, sprains, or heat-related issues. :*One change that Disney made to assist character performers was to change rules limiting the overall costume weight to be no more than 25% of the performer's body weight. {{CN|date=October 2018}}
===Donald Duck=== * A 27-year-old woman from [[Upper Darby, Pennsylvania]], filed a lawsuit in August 2010 against the Disney corporation, claiming that the [[Donald Duck]] character groped her during a photo and autograph session in May 2008 while she and her family were visiting Epcot. The lawsuit is for US$200,000 in damages to compensate the alleged victim for negligence, battery, negligent infliction of emotional distress and intentional and reckless infliction of emotional distress. The woman claims to suffer from severe physical injury, emotional anguish and distress, acute anxiety, headaches, nightmares and flashbacks, and other emotional and physical ailments. Part of the lawsuit's basis is a report from the Orange County Sheriff's Office that alleged similar acts by costumed characters have been reported to them 24 times since 2004. The woman did not file a complaint at the time of the incident.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/local/breakingnews/os-disney-donald-duck-groping-lawsuit20100812,0,6804076.story |title=Walt Disney faces $200,000 lawsuit in alleged Donald Duck groping case |date=August 12, 2010 |accessdate=August 12, 2010 |first=Walter |last=Pacheco |publisher=Orlando Sentinel}}</ref> Disney settled the lawsuit with the claimant for an undisclosed amount in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://philadelphiapersonalinjuryblog.com/2011/05/disney-settles-lawsuit-by-april-magolon-in-philadelphia.html |title=Disney Settles Donald Duck Suit by April Magolon |date=May 17, 2011 |accessdate=July 8, 2013 |first=Erline |last=Aguiluz |publisher=The Philadelphia Personal Injury Law Blog |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140202233428/http://philadelphiapersonalinjuryblog.com/2011/05/disney-settles-lawsuit-by-april-magolon-in-philadelphia.html |archivedate=February 2, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===Goofy=== * In September 2004, a [[#Tigger|Disney employee who had been accused]] of a different act was suspended for allegedly shoving two [[Kodak]] employees while he was dressed as [[Goofy]] at Animal Kingdom on August 29, 2004. The two photographers believed that Goofy was a different employee who was joking around until they were relaxing backstage and saw it was not their friend. The cast member's attorney stated that the two photographers shoved back as part of routine horseplay among employees meant to entertain. The sheriff's office was considering misdemeanor charges.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.local10.com/news/3734863/detail.html |title=Tigger Character Suspended By Disney Again, This Time As Goofy |publisher=Local 10 |date=September 16, 2004 |accessdate=January 6, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927044936/http://www.local10.com/news/3734863/detail.html |archivedate=September 27, 2007 |df= }}</ref> During the investigation, two Animal Kingdom employees came forward saying the cast member had touched their breasts. The lawyer claimed that the cast member was merely looking at their [[lanyard]]s containing [[Disney pin trading|lapel trading pins]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.local6.com/news/3752684/detail.html |title=Disney Character Faces More 'Touching' Accusations |publisher=Local 6 |date=September 22, 2004 |accessdate=January 12, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070111190916/http://www.local6.com/news/3752684/detail.html |archivedate=January 11, 2007 |df= }}</ref>
===Minnie Mouse=== * On June 7, 2009, a 60-year-old man from [[Cressona, Pennsylvania]], touched the cast member dressed as [[Minnie Mouse]] while he was visiting the Magic Kingdom. The case went to trial on August 11, 2009. The victim claims that the man groped her in the photo. The man pleaded guilty to the incident. He was convicted of charges of misdemeanor battery,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wmbfnews.com/story/10886776/pa-man-found-guilty-of-groping-minnie-mouse |publisher=WMBF News |accessdate=August 11, 2009 |date=August 11, 2009 |agency=NBC |title=Man guilty of groping Minnie Mouse at Disney |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222024522/http://www.wmbfnews.com/story/10886776/pa-man-found-guilty-of-groping-minnie-mouse |archivedate=February 22, 2014 |df= }}</ref> and was sentenced 180 days of probation and 570 hours of community service.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailypilot.com/topic/wpix-man-guilty-fondling-minnie-mouse,0,546662.story |publisher=Daily Pilot |accessdate=August 11, 2009 |date=August 11, 2009 |first=Stephanie |last=Barish |title=Man Found Guilty Of Molesting Minnie Mouse At Disney World |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222141828/http://www.dailypilot.com/topic/wpix-man-guilty-fondling-minnie-mouse%2C0%2C546662.story |archivedate=February 22, 2014 |df= }}</ref>
===Tigger=== {{Wikinewspar2|CBS blog criticizes stations' coverage of Tigger incident|Teamsters Union comments on Tigger incident|Full video of Tigger incident reveals different story|Accusations Tigger threw punch fill airwaves as teen claims neck injuries}} * In April 2004, a 36-year-old Disney employee was arrested for allegedly fondling a 13-year-old girl and her mother while he was dressed as Tigger during a photo opportunity at the Magic Kingdom in February 2004. He was charged with one count of lewd and lascivious molestation of a child between 12 and 15 years old and one count of simple battery.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.local6.com/news/2971289/detail.html |title='Tigger' Arrested On Molestation Charges |publisher=Local 6 |date=April 2, 2004 |accessdate=January 6, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20041011200218/http://www.local6.com/news/2971289/detail.html |archivedate=October 11, 2004}}</ref> The case went to trial, during which the defense produced the Tigger costume itself to demonstrate the difficulties of maneuvering the costume's oversize gloves and the limited line of sight of the actor in the costume. The jury deliberated less than one hour before acquitting the employee of all charges. The employee returned to work at Disney.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.local6.com/news/3616080/detail.html |title='Tigger' Found Not Guilty Of Molesting Girl |publisher=Local 6 |date=August 4, 2004 |accessdate=January 6, 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090116005434/http://www.clickorlando.com/news/3616080/detail.html |archivedate=January 16, 2009}}</ref> * On January 5, 2007, a 14-year-old boy from [[Greenville, New Hampshire]] was [[allegedly]] punched in the head by a Disney employee dressed as [[Tigger]] during a photo opportunity at Disney's Hollywood Studios.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.local6.com/news/10685989/detail.html |title=Home Video Shows 'Tigger' Character Apparently Punching Boy's Face (article with video of incident) |publisher=Local 6 |date=January 6, 2007 |accessdate=January 6, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070109011729/http://www.local6.com/news/10685989/detail.html |archivedate=January 9, 2007 |df= }}</ref> The family felt that the act was deliberate and filed a police report of [[battery (crime)|battery]] against the cast member from [[Kissimmee, Florida]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.local6.com/download/2007/0108/10698289.pdf |format=PDF |title=PDF of filed police report of alleged Tigger assault |publisher=Local 6 |date=January 5, 2007 |accessdate=January 12, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070111191402/http://www.local6.com/download/2007/0108/10698289.pdf |archivedate=January 11, 2007 |df= }}</ref> The cast member was suspended pending the results of the investigation.<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/orl-bk-tigger,0,4803916.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |title = Disney suspends accused Tigger |publisher = Orlando Sentinel |date = January 6, 2007 |accessdate =January 6, 2007 }}</ref> In the cast member's statement to the sheriff's office, he claimed that he was acting in self-defense as the child was pulling on the back of the costume and causing him to lose his breath.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.local6.com/news/10694041/detail.html |title=Videotaped 'Tigger' Whack At Disney World Grabs National Attention |publisher=Local 6 |date=January 8, 2007 |accessdate=January 8, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070110223721/http://www.local6.com/news/10694041/detail.html |archivedate=January 10, 2007 |df= }}</ref> A lawyer for the employee accused in the 2004 case against Tigger released his own opinion on the situation. He believed the child instigated the situation and that the cast member's movements were an involuntary reaction to pain. The lawyer was not representing the accused cast member at the time of this statement.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.local6.com/news/10715994/detail.html |title=Lawyer: 'Tigger' Swat Was Instigated |publisher=Local 6 |date=January 10, 2007 |accessdate=January 11, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070112091524/http://www.local6.com/news/10715994/detail.html |archivedate=January 12, 2007 |df= }}</ref> On February 15, 2007, the State Attorney General's office announced that no charges would be filed against the cast member.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/orl-bk-tigger021507,0,4679653.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |title=No charges to be filed after 'Tigger' complaint |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=February 15, 2007 |accessdate=February 15, 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070220075655/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/business/tourism/orl-bk-tigger021507%2C0%2C4679653.story?coll=orl-home-headlines |archivedate=February 20, 2007 |df= }}</ref>
==Resort hotels==
===Disney's Art of Animation Resort=== {{Main|Disney's Art of Animation Resort}} * On July 14, 2015, a 3-year-old child was found at the bottom of a resort pool after becoming separated from his parents. Officials with the Orange County Sheriff's Office reported the child was later pronounced dead at an area hospital.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-art-of-animation-drowning-disney-20150714-story.html |title=Child drowns in pool at Disney's Art of Animation Resort |first=David |last=Harris |work=orlandosentinel.com |publisher=Tribune Newspapers |date=July 14, 2015 |accessdate=July 15, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150715165800/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-art-of-animation-drowning-disney-20150714-story.html |archivedate=July 15, 2015 |df= }}</ref>
===Disney's BoardWalk Inn=== {{Main|Disney's BoardWalk Inn}} * On June 29, 2000, a waiter and a child were held hostage by the child's father in a hotel room over domestic issues. During the hostage situation, other guests were evacuated and given alternative accommodations in the resort. The man released the hostages and handed himself over to authorities in the early hours of June 30, 2000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2000-06-30/news/0006300266_1_rodriguez-huggins-waiter |title=Hostages Freed At Disney – Orlando Sentinel |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=June 30, 2000 |accessdate=May 22, 2012 |first=Pamela J. |last=Johnson |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130906061117/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2000-06-30/news/0006300266_1_rodriguez-huggins-waiter |archivedate=September 6, 2013 |df= }}</ref>
===Disney's Contemporary Resort=== {{Main|Disney's Contemporary Resort}} *On November 12, 1992, an off-duty cast member fell off the ledge outside the Top of The World restaurant on the 15th floor of the Contemporary. The cast member had been sitting on the ledge when a swarm of [[wasp]]s appeared. Trying to swat them away, the cast member lost his balance and fell to his death 11 stories below.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Villarreal |first1=Luz |title=Disney Employee Falls To Death At Hotel |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1992-11-13/news/9211130280_1_observation-deck-contemporary-resort-wasps |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=November 13, 1992 |language=en}}</ref> *On March 22, 2016, a death occurred at Disney's Contemporary Resort. The monorail's service was temporarily suspended while Orange County Sheriff's Office investigated. Investigators announced that they believe that the person took their own life. According to multiple sources, the person jumped to their death inside the central A-frame tower.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.disneylists.com/2016/03/breaking-news-tragedy-contemporary-resort-disney-world/ |title=BREAKING NEWS: Tragedy at Contemporary Resort at Disney World |author=admin |work=DisneyLists.com |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160326220947/http://www.disneylists.com/2016/03/breaking-news-tragedy-contemporary-resort-disney-world/ |archivedate=March 26, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/2917074/police-investigating-death-at-disneys-contemporary-resort-person-suspected-of-jumping-to-death/ |first=Danny |last=Cox |title=Police Investigating Death At Disney’s Contemporary Resort — Person Suspected Of Jumping To Death |work=The Inquisitr News |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160323184241/http://www.inquisitr.com/2917074/police-investigating-death-at-disneys-contemporary-resort-person-suspected-of-jumping-to-death/ |archivedate=March 23, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mynews13.com/content/news/cfnews13/on-the-town/article.html/content/news/articles/cfn/2016/3/22/deputies_investigati.html?a |title=Deputies investigating death at Disney World resort |publisher= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160323184123/http://www.mynews13.com/content/news/cfnews13/on-the-town/article.html/content/news/articles/cfn/2016/3/22/deputies_investigati.html?a |archivedate=March 23, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wdwinfo.com/news-stories/police-investigate-death-at-disneys-contemporary-resort/ |title=Police investigate death at Disney’s Contemporary Resort |first=Leah |last=Zanolla |publisher= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160323184214/http://www.wdwinfo.com/news-stories/police-investigate-death-at-disneys-contemporary-resort/ |archivedate=March 23, 2016 |df= }}</ref> *On May 28, 2018, an intoxicated man was arrested at Disney's Contemporary Resort after he falsely told other guests an active shooter was in the resort. Panic soon followed and the resort was placed on lockdown until police could arrive. The reports were traced back to the man, who was found hiding in bushes outside of the resort. In questioning the man claimed he did it to get reactions from people for a class and his YouTube channel.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Harris |first1=David |title=YouTube stunt at Disney resort lands Arizona man in jail |url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-youtube-dillion-burch-stunt-20180529-story.html |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=May 30, 2018}}</ref>
===Disney's Fort Wilderness=== {{Main|Disney's Fort Wilderness Resort & Campground}} * On August 22, 1980, an 11-year-old boy from [[New York City]] died after swimming in the [[Disney's River Country|River Country]] water park next to the campground. The cause of death was [[amoebic meningoencephalitis]], traces of which were found in the water.<ref name=rivercountry>{{cite web|url=http://www.yesterland.com/rivercountry.html |title=Yesterland.com: River Country Closed by Brain-Eating Amoeba? (Part 1 of 2) |publisher= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150831064913/http://www.yesterland.com/rivercountry.html |archivedate=August 31, 2015 |df= }}</ref> * On April 16, 1982, a 36-year-old woman from [[Little Silver, New Jersey]], collapsed and died while walking away from the Water Flume ride in River Country.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1356&dat=19820418&id=hrRPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=LwYEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4471,933521&hl=en|title=Tourist Dies After Disney World Ride|work=Ocala Star-Banner|date=Apr 18, 1982|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}</ref> * On August 9, 1982, a 14-year-old boy from [[Erie, North Dakota]], drowned at River Country. He was pulled from the water at the River Country Cove about five minutes after the youth slid down a 60-foot slide into five feet of water. He was pronounced dead at a hospital.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1356&dat=19820812&id=W7JPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=2wUEAAAAIBAJ&pg=5034,6275414&hl=en|title=Disney Won't Hire Extra Life Guards|work=Ocala Star-Banner|date=Aug 12, 1982|accessdate=October 1, 2016}}</ref> * On October 10, 1986, an 8-year-old boy was attacked by an alligator when he and his siblings were wandering near the lake's edge while watching ducks.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fox25boston.com/news/nh-child-attacked-by-gator-at-disney-world-30-years-ago/345144911 |title=NH child attacked by gator at Disney World 30 years ago |publisher=Fox 25 Boston |first=Kathryn |last=Burcham |date=June 15, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160617134150/http://www.fox25boston.com/news/nh-child-attacked-by-gator-at-disney-world-30-years-ago/345144911 |archivedate=June 17, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1986-10-12/news/8603020367_1_long-alligator-reptile-mrs-santamaria |title=Boy Survives Attack By 7-foot Alligator |work=SunSentinel.com |date=October 12, 1986 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618020558/http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1986-10-12/news/8603020367_1_long-alligator-reptile-mrs-santamaria |archivedate=June 18, 2016 |df= }}</ref> * On May 23, 1987, a 6-year-old boy drowned in a swimming pool. The family later sued, stating that resort should have had more than one lifeguard on duty to monitor the crowded pool, and that the pool should have had a safety line between the shallow and deep ends.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1988-06-15/news/8802040970_1_missouri-diaz-campground-lifeguard |title=Parents, Disney Settle Suit $250,000 To Be Paid In Boy`s Drowning |first=Carolyn |last=Jung |work=SunSentinel.com |date=June 15, 1988 |accessdate=April 17, 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140202193312/http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1988-06-15/news/8802040970_1_missouri-diaz-campground-lifeguard |archivedate=February 2, 2014 |df= }}</ref> * On July 10, 1989, a 13-year-old boy from [[Longwood, Florida]], drowned at River Country. He was swimming with eight classmates and two counselors. 15 minutes later, another swimmer felt the youth under his feet in about 5 feet (1.52 m) of water and dragged him out. He was pronounced dead on arrival at Sand Lake Hospital.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1989-07-11/news/8907110017_1_christopher-longwood-fifteen-minutes|title=Longwood Boy Drowns At Disney|work=Orlando Sentinel|date=Jul 10, 1989|accessdate=October 1, 2016}}</ref>
===Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa=== {{Main|Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa}} * On October 9, 1989, a 33-year-old woman from [[Glen Cove, New York]], was killed when a tiny speedboat collided with a ferry boat. She and her 8-year-old son were broadsided by the ferry while trying to videotape friends and family members who were water skiing in the [[Seven Seas Lagoon]]. A crew member and a visitor on the ferry dived into the water and rescued her son. The boy was not hurt in the accident.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1291&dat=19891011&id=Y_9TAAAAIBAJ&sjid=uI0DAAAAIBAJ&pg=2268,3904081&hl=en|title=Woman killed when boat collides with ferry at Disney|publisher=Boca Raton News|date=Oct 11, 1989|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}</ref> The family sued Disney for $240 million, claiming that the ferry's operators should have seen the speedboat before it came so close.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1990-02-25/news/9002253491_1_schenck-walt-disney-napoli |title=Victim's Kin Sue Disney Over Fatal Boat Collision |publisher=Orlando Sentinel |date=Feb 25, 1990 |accessdate=June 25, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160326054426/http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1990-02-25/news/9002253491_1_schenck-walt-disney-napoli |archivedate=March 26, 2016 |df= }}</ref> * On June 14, 2016, a 2-year-old boy from [[Elkhorn, Omaha, Nebraska|Elkhorn, Nebraska]], was splashing around in the shallows of the Seven Seas Lagoon at 9:15 PM where it was posted not to go into the water. After the boy and his family went to a movie night on the beach, he was attacked and killed by an [[alligator]] who pulled and grabbed him from the shore into the Seven Seas Lagoon. His parents tried to intervene, but they were unsuccessful, and the boy subsequently died due to drowning. The boy's body was found intact at approximately 1:45 PM the following afternoon, in the vicinity of where he went missing; he was found {{convert|12|to|15|yd|m}} from the shore in about {{convert|6|ft|m}} of water<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-child-dragged-alligator-disney-20160614-story.html |title=Alligator attacks 2-year-old boy at Disney's Grand Floridian, recovery effort continues — Orlando Sentinel |work=[[Orlando Sentinel]] |accessdate=June 15, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160615044828/http://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-child-dragged-alligator-disney-20160614-story.html |archivedate=June 15, 2016 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Madigan |first=Nick |last2=Hauser |first2=Christine |title=Divers Find Body of Toddler Snatched by Alligator at Disney Resort |website=The New York Times |date=June 15, 2016 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/16/us/alligator-child-florida-orlando-disney.html |accessdate=June 16, 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160616022014/http://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/16/us/alligator-child-florida-orlando-disney.html |archivedate=June 16, 2016 |df= }}</ref> The [[medical examiner]] ruled that the child died of "drowning and traumatic injuries."
